loans.name: Nhóm 03-Phố Sơn Vạn-P.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hường operates a food stall/restaurant, selling pork. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pork to resell.

Hường is 37 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hường is the group leader of the Nhóm 03-Phố Sơn Vạn-P.Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution. 

Hường has been involved in her business for 5 years. The main hardship that Hường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more pork to resell.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 49 years old and married to Joseph. She supports seven family members. She has been a dairy farmer for the last 14 years and the business earns her an income of KES 11,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for an increased number of liters of milk to supply to clients daily and meet their demands.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for an increased number of liters of milk to supply to clients daily and meet their demands.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana had to leave school after eighth grade. After raising her children, she became a ‎kindergarten assistant. Sultana wanted to supplement her income. She opened her ‎home-based undergarments and clothing store. Sultana has been able to see her ‎business develop and is proud of her accomplishments so far.‎

She needed this loan to purchase new inventory.‎

Sultana wants to see her business continue and create a stronger economic future for ‎herself.‎

loans.use: to purchase new inventory of undergarments and clothing

loans.name: Ureyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ureyda es una mujer proactiva, emprendedora y perseverante. Actualmente, estudia y trabaja a la vez, para apoyar económicamente su educación  y la de sus hijos. Ella se siente agradecida porque gracias a un financiamiento de MiCrédito, pudo  comprar un exhibidor para comida, una refrigeradora y demás productos para su comedería. 

Sin embargo, para ayudarse en sus estudios solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar una computadora que le servirá para realizar con rapidez y eficacia sus trabajos universitarios. Ureyda planea seguir trabajando con MiCrédito.
texts.en:
Ureyda is a proactive woman, enterprising and persevering. She is a student and works at the same time to pay for school and to support her children. She is grateful that she was able to buy a display case for food, a refrigerator, and more products for her eatery through financing from Kiva partner MiCrédito.

To help her in her studies, she is requesting another loan to buy a computer so that she can quickly and effectively complete her academic assignments. Ureyda plans to continue working with MiCrédito.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase herbicides, insecticides, fertilizers, and certified seeds.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 35 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей школьников. На сегодняшний день Батма, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Батмы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: лошадь, 6 коров, 10 овец. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает рис, клевер, люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет 22,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и воспитание 4 детей. Поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Батма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота и доходов от бизнес деятельности. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Batma is 35 years old, a widow, and the mother of four school-age children. Today, for her family's main income Batma rears animals and grows crops, having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Batma has a horse, six cows, and ten sheep. She grows rice, clover, and alfalfa on three hectares of land. Her monthly income is 22,000 som (KGS) but this money is not enough to have a decent life and raise four children. As a result, in order to further develop her business, Batma has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her herd and the income from her business activities. Batma plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing the size of her herd of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Ignacia Aydalina

texts.es:
La venta de mangos, jocotes, golosinas, y yuca ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos para Ignacia. Y gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito ha podido invertir su pequeño negocio con la compra de sus productos, que la han ayudado a prosperar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.  

Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar galletas, caramelos, mangos, jocotes, y demás productos. Esto le sería de mucha porque al  ofrecer productos frescos y variados, en consiguiente sus ventas aumentaran. Ignacia planea mejorar su vivienda con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
The sale of mangoes, jocotes, candies, and yucca has been the main source of income for Ignacia. Thanks to the financing from MiCrédito, she has been able to invest in her small business with the purchase of her products, which have helped her to prosper and bring her children out ahead, for which she feels very thankful.

Nevertheless, she is requesting a new loan to purchase cookies, candies, mangoes, jocotes, and other products. This would help her a lot because when offering fresh and varied products, her sales will increase. Ignacia plans to improve her home with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, candies, mangoes, jocotes, and other products.

loans.name: Done Group

texts.en:
Mong is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Mong and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  

Charcoal, firewood and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Mong and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Mong and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne diseases. And after totaling up the costs, Mong and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. 

Children pictured are children of borrowers in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es una señora de 61 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos son independientes, comenta que toda su vida se ha dedicado a la ganadería y que las cuotas del préstamo las paga de la venta de la leche, añade que con este negocio se ha ayudado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, Graciela solicita el dinero del creditro para invertirlo en la compra de uanvaca. El esposo de Graciela se dedica a la agricultura y también le apoya en la ganadería, la aspiración de Graciela es lograr comprar un terreno para criar a sus vacas y seguir trabajando mientras le queden fuerzas.
texts.en:
Graciela is 61 years old and has six children, who all live on their own. She says she has worked with livestock her whole life and that she makes her loan payments with what she earns by selling milk. She also says that her business has helped her provide for her children.

Graciela is requesting this loan to invest money in buying a cow. Her husband is a farmer and also helps her with her livestock. Graciela's goal is to be able to buy a plot of land to raise her cows and to continue working for as long as she is strong enough.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Искандар  41 летный мужчина городка Куляб. Он семейный человек. У него 12,8 и 6 летные дочери, и 11, 4 летные сыновья. Дети учатся в средней школе. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Искандар трудолюбивый и заботливый человек. Он во дворе имеет коровник, и там выращивает крупнорогатого скота. 5 лет Искандар продвигает свою деятельность. Его научил заниматься этим видом деятельностью его брат.  Искандар решил идти по его стопам. Он хочет купить крупнорогатого скота, и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности. Искандар обратился к Вам за кредитом, потому что он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Iskandar is a 41-year-old man from the town of Kulob. He is a family man: he has 12-, 8- and 6-year-old daughters, and 11- and 4-year-old sons. His children go to school. His wife is a housewife. Iskandar himself is a hard-working and caring person. He has a cowshed in his yard, and he raises cattle there. Iskandar has been in this business for five years. His brother taught him how to do this type of work. Iskandar decided to follow in his footsteps. He wants to buy cattle and increase the size of his herd, and thus to increase his income from his animal rearing business. Iskandar has turned to you for a loan because he believes in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling fish.

Melita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Melita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc. for her fishing business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 47 years old and married with five children, one of whom is still in school.

Rosie is in the agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 24 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Leah has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra Luisa

texts.es:
Alejandra tiene 30 años y es mamá soltera. Vive con su hijo de un año en Chihuahua, el estado más extenso de México y que comparte frontera con Estados Unidos. Alejandra es psicóloga y ofrece terapia en su casa. Mientras estaba estudiando la licenciatura, comenzó a trabajar en una florería para pagar sus estudios. Alejandra descubrió que le gusta mucho la naturaleza y se considera amante de las flores. 
Decidió combinar su pasión por las flores y las ganas de tener un negocio y abrió una florería. Desde hace tres años ha repartido felicidad en forma de flores. En la región en la que vive casi no hay trabajo pero su negocio ha sido muy exitoso por la atención que los clientes reciben por parte de todos los empleados. Alejandra quiere implementar un sistema de terapias florales a sus pacientes, que los ayudará a entrar en plena armonía. 
Este préstamo de Kiva le ayudará a Alejandra a comprar flores y bases para surtir los pedidos del Día de las Madres. “No hay nada mejor que ofrecerle un pedacito de amor a quienes nos han regalado la vida”, dice Alejandra. Su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa y estabilidad financiera para que a su hijo nunca le falte nada. Cuando Alejandra lleva a su hijo a la florería, él imita todo lo que ella hace y le gustaría que cuando crezca él continue manejando este negocio.
Este es su primer préstamo con Konfío y está segura de que sus ventas incrementarán notablemente, lo que le permitirá realizar pagos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 30 years old and a single mom. She lives with her one year old son in Chihuahua, the largest state of Mexico and shares a border with the United States. Alejandra is a psychologist and provides therapy at home. While studying her degree, she began working in a flower shop to pay for her studies. Alejandra discovered that she loves nature and loves flowers.
She decided to combine her passion for flowers and the desire to have a business and opened a flower shop. For three years it has spread happiness in the form of flowers. In the region in which she lives, there is almost no work but her business has been very successful because of the attention that customers receive from all employees. Alejandra wants to implement a system of floral therapies to their patients, which will help them get into full harmony.
This Kiva loan will help Alejandra to buy flowers and vases to fill orders for Mother's Day. "There is nothing better to offer a bit of love to those who have given us life," says Alejandra. Her biggest dream is to own a home and provide financial stability for her child to never miss anything. When Alejandra takes her son to the florist, he imitates everything she does and would like to continue running business when he is older.
This is her first loan with Konfío, and she is confident that sales will increase significantly, allowing her to make payments on time.

loans.use: to buy flowers to cover Mother's Day orders.

loans.name: Xomxeun Group

texts.en: Pheng is excited the water filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Pheng and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Pheng and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Pheng and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Pheng and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families. The children pictured are children of borrowers in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Milton Eduardo

texts.es: Son 19 años de lo que Eduardo se dedica a la ganadería y también se dedica al jornal de trabajos del campo, este señor se caracteriza por ser serio en sus negocio, tiene una conviviente y 3 hijos de 3, 8 y 10 años de los que los 2 mayores se encuentran estudiando, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vacona para ampliar su negocio, comenta que para criar su ganado Eduardo paga de arriendo de la hierba y pero si le queda ganancias , Eduardo comenta que la vida en el campo es dura y que en verdad es necesario trabajar duro y mucho mas cuando se tiene 3 hijos que mentener. Eduardo trabaja por el bienestar de sus hijos y  desea que logren terminar sus metas propuestas en cuanto al estudio.
texts.en: For 19 years Eduardo has made a living in cattle and also with the daily wage of farmwork. This man is characterized as serious in his business. He has a partner and 3 children aged 3, 8, and 10. The two oldest are studying. This loan is going to invest in buying an adult cow to expand his business. Eduardo says that raising cattle pays for renting the field but does not leave profits. Eduardo says that life on the farm is hard and it is truly necessary to work hard, even more when you have 3 children to support. Eduardo works for the welfare of his children and wants them to achieve their dreams of studying more.

loans.use: to buy an adult cow

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Phố Tân Thành-P.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 52 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Tâm is the group leader of the Nhóm 01-Phố Tân Thành-P.đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

Tâm operates a food stall/restaurant, selling soup. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tâm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2009, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Tâm has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase food to cook breakfast for sale.

Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house with her business profit.

loans.use: to purchase food to cook breakfast for sale

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a married man and has one child. He describes himself as social, and he operates a tailoring shop where he makes dresses, coats, and shirts. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His shop is located in an attractive area and his primary customers are locals. 

Solomon cites price fluctuation as his biggest business challenge. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials, and his goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank (his previous loan was repaid successfully).

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Velis Nohemy

texts.es:
Velis, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja de mecánico, tiene 4 hijos, todos viven aparte y dos estudian.

Velis, se dedica a la sastrería desde hace 10 años, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, trabaja de lunes a sábado, los días de vacación le ayudan sus hijos. 

Velis, necesita el dinero para comprar tela, hilos, broches, botones, listones y además comprar una maquina rana, todo esto para mejorar la calidad de sus costuras. 

Velis, sueña con tener un taller de sastrería para poder emplear a más personas y que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida y tener un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Velis, 48, studied until the sixth grade.  She’s married, and her husband works as a mechanic. She has four children, all of whom live apart. Two are studying. 

Velis has been working in tailoring for ten years.  She has her business in her house, and she works from Monday to Saturday.  Her children help her on vacation days. 

Velis needs the money to purchase fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons, and ribbons; and to purchase an overlock sewing machine. All of this is to improve the quality of her sewing.

Velis dreams of having a tailoring shop where she could employ more people; that her children may have a better standard of living; and of having a bigger income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons, ribbons, and an overlock sewing machine--all to improve the quality of her sewing.

loans.name: Boungkuang Group

texts.en: Bounlay understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Bounlay knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounlay purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Bounlay is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana se dedica al negocio de venta de maiz,la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz,la socia vende en diferentes mercados, la socia por medio de este negocio le gustaría abrir una tienda de abarrotes, ella es una personas muy emprendedora y quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LLANKACHINAPAC DE URUBAMBA"; the bank is located in the Urubamba district, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

The member Juana sells corn at various markets, and she has a land where she grows corn. Through this business, she would like to open a grocery store, she is very enterprising and wants to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

The member is very happy for this loan and promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жительница района Восе. Она на районе проживает вместе матерью, братом и детьми. Она разведена мужем. Дети учатся в средней школе. Дилбару 29 лет. Он еще молодая мама. Дилбар активная и целеустремленная  женщина. 4 года назад Дилбар решила открыть свой бизнес, чтобы обеспечить семью. Она начала изучать профессию швеи, чтобы зарабатывать таким путем для улучшения условий жизни семьи. Дилбар быстро освоила эту деятельность. Она шьет на очень старой швейной машинке. Дилбар на сумму кредита хочет приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку. Она очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Dilbar is a resident of the Vose region. She lives there together with her mother, brother, and children. She is divorced. Her children study in secondary school. Dilbar is 29 years old. She is still a young mother. Dilbar is an active and ambitious woman. Four years ago, Dilbar decided to open her own business in order to provide for her family. She began learning the profession of a seamstress in order to earn money that way to improve her family's living conditions. Dilbar quickly mastered this activity. She sews on a very old sewing machine. Dilbar wants to buy an updated sewing machine with the loan. She very much hopes for financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nieves Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Rocio ella es conviviente y tiene 53 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos y chompas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers are part of the communal bank "Virgin of the Snows". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is located in the province and department of Cusco. 
Rocio is a member of this group and she is 53 years old. She is in a domestic partnership and has one son. She runs an artisan business selling fabrics, sweaters, tablecloths and curtains. She sells various fabrics. Rocio works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. and has been in this business for 8 years. It is going very well for her. Her dream is to grow this business selling fabrics and curtains. She requests this loan to purchase fabrics and sweaters.

The members who are attached to the photo, took the photo after the meeting since they were working.
 
The other group members sell clothing and cell phones and have a grocery store and restaurant. 
Rocio is grateful to those who are supporting this dream through this platform and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters and fabric.

loans.name: Edita Ines

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años, los mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista. Ella hace tiempo atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia en la localidad.
Doña Edita tiene un taller de costura, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, actualmente ha estado muy ocupada ya que cogió contratos con instituciones educativas para el Estado y su trabajo aumento mucho. Gracias al crédito que recibió con la ayuda de Kiva y de la institución pudo comprar todo el material que necesitaba para poder cumplir con sus trabajos, actualmente necesita otro crédito ya que aun no le cancelan sus trabajos anteriores y tiene muchos trabajos ahora con instituciones educativas privadas, en esta temporada ella aprovecha para coger muchos contratos por que sus ganancias le sirven para los gastos que tienen en la educación de sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos y otros  materiales de costura. Esta desde el inicio   en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su taller.
texts.en:
The Credit Group of Hardworking Friends gets together every two weeks in Cantón Rocafuerte, a place known for the great variety of sweets made there which are nationally recognized for their delicious flavor.  

La senora Edita lives here, she is 40 years old, is married and has three children, ages 15, 13 and 10.  The older children study in high school and the younger in primary school.  Her husband is a carpenter.  A while ago she learned dressmaking in a local academy.  Dona Edita has a sewing workshop.  The she works making all types of clothing for women, men and children.  Now she is very busy as she was awarded contracts with educational institutions for the state and her work increased a lot.  

Thanks to the loan that she received with the help of Kiva and from the institution, she was able to purchase all of the material that she needed to be able to fill her contracts.  Now she needs another loan as they have not cancelled her earlier contracts and she has many orders now with private schools.  In this season she is taking the opportunity to get many contracts because her earnings help with the cost of her children's education.  This new loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread and other sewing materials.  She has been a member of the Credit Group since the beginning and she likes it because of the assistance that the loans offer.  Her dream is to continue improving her workshop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines (she buys and sells them). Melly has been in this business for 8 years, and she is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. 

Melly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loan from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 35 years old and married with one child. For the past six years she has run her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Stephanie is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy more stock for her store, such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, drinks, juice, bread, etc. She is working hard to provide for her family and secure their future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari-sari, or small general store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 73 years old and a widow. She has five children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 31 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Estrella aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Angela Isamar

texts.es:
Angela, es una joven para la cual sus estudios van primero que todo, ella tiene veinte y un años de edad, estudia la licenciatura en tecnología médica. Su madre, la cual trabaja en el área de limpieza de un centro de salud ha sido su principal apoyo. Esta estudiante siente una gran pasión al trabajar con personas y cree que es de vital importancia aportar para el desarrollo  de la medicina. 
En estos momentos, Angela, recurre a Kiva y MiCrédito, para ser beneficiada con un préstamo que le permita comprar una computadora, para así realizar sus trabajos con más facilidad y entregarlos con mejor presentación.  Ella tiene muchas esperanzas en el futuro, desea poder montar su propia clínica para hacer exámenes médicos, a las personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
For young Angela, school comes before everything else. She is twenty-one years old and is studying for her licensure in medical technology. Her mother, who works cleaning a health center, is her primary support. This student feels a strong passion for working with people and she believes it's vitally important to contribute to the development of medicine.

At this time, Angela is turning to Kiva and MiCrédito, hoping to benefit from a loan that will allow her to buy a computer. A computer would help her do her work more easily and present her assignments better. She has many hopes for the future; she even wants to start up her own clinic where she can do medical exams for people who need them.

loans.use: buy a computer to support her schoolwork

loans.name: Phonyeang Group

texts.en: Khamphoud understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Khamphoud knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and that boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Khamphoud purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal. It will also decrease the time and cost spent foraging for firewood, and it eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Khamphoud is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Parkphoy Group

texts.en: Thoumthong is excited the water filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Thoumthong and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Thoumthong and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Thoumthong and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Thoumthong and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: San Bartolome Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN BARTOLOME” iniciará el décimo tercer  ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos, venta de productos lácteos, venta de cosméticos, venta de dulces, venta de mantas, venta de masitas y venta de bisutería. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la banca comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de bisutería; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace ocho años, adquiriendo el conocimiento por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pendientes, anillos y collares por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Bartolome are starting their thirteenth cycle with Pro Mujer, working with one of the organisation's regional offices in Santiago. It is managed by a board of directors of which Elizabeth is president. The members of this communal bank are all working to improve very different businesses, including: sales of sportswear, dairy products, cosmetics, candy, blankets, pastries and costume jewelry . 

The loan will benefit female micro-entrepreneurs, including Elizabeth. She says that it is her first loan cycle through Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a friend who is part of the communal bank. Elizabeth currently has a business selling costume jewelry; she explains that she began this business eight years ago, learning everything needed through her own initiative.

This loan will be to increase her stock (to buy earrings, rings and necklaces wholesale) which she will acquire from merchants in the city of El Alto, and will then install them in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and the healthcare that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, earrings and rings wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in an iron for larger pupusas, corn, beans, cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, bags, pork rind, loroco (a local herb), squash, etc.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
La socia  Jacoba se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante  asu familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jacoba runs a business selling crafts. Through her work, she wants to provide for her family. Her dream is to expand her business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy knitted products, sweaters, and looms.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy knitted products, sweaters, and looms.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a mother of five children who has always known she had the knowledge and drive to improve ‎her family’s economic situation. She has a talent for baking and cooking, so Iman decided ‎to open a home-based bakery. She supplies her cakes, cookies and specialty products to ‎event and business meeting coordinators and to customers to be enjoyed at home.‎

Iman is applying for a 7,000 ILS loan through Kiva's field partner Koret Israel Economic Development Funds to upgrade her oven and for supplies.‎ She wants to continue her work and expand to selling for municipality events ‎one day.‎

loans.use: to upgrade her oven and for supplies.

loans.name: Nhóm 03-Phố 6-P.đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Châu operates a food stall/restaurant selling processed food. She is requesting a loan to purchase food to process for sale. Châu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Châu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Châu is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Châu is the group leader of the Nhóm 03-Phố 6-P.Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2010, Châu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Châu has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Châu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase food to process for sale

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.ru:
Гулбарг та женщина, которая пережила много бед, но не сдалась и не потеряла себя. Гулбарг не отчаялась на попытки судьбы сломать ее. Она сильная и в себе уверенная женщина в то и время женственная и хрупкая. Гулбарг потеряла своего мужа. Он скончался, и ей пришлось поставить своих детей на ногу одна. Гулбарг мать троих детей. Старшую дочку выдала замуж и живет вместе с двумя сыновьями. Старшему сыну 22 года, он работает официантом, а младшему сыну 11 лет, он учится в средней школе. Гулбарг нашла в себе силы жить дальше благодаря своим детям. 
   Гулбарг занимается продажей семечек, орешек и лепешек. Этой деятельностью она занята около 11 лет. Гулбарг обратилась за кредитом, потому что очень хочет осуществить свою мечту. Она давно мечтала купить мебель для дома и копила очень долго на покупку, но все равно ей не хватает средств. Гулбарг приняла решение обратиться за кредитом. За счет своей деятельности она планирует погашать займу. Она Гулбарг верит, что ее обязательно поддержать. Спасибо.
texts.en:
Gulbarg is a woman who has lived through a lot of misfortunes, but has not given up and has not lost herself. Gulbarg did not despair at the attempts of fate to break her. She is a strong and self-confident woman and at the same time feminine and delicate. Gulbarg lost her husband. He died, and she had to put her children on their feet on her own. Gulbarg is the mother of three children. She married off her eldest daughter and she lives with her two sons. Her eldest son is 22 years old and works as a waiter, and her youngest son is 11 years old and studies in secondary school. Gulbarg found the strength in side her to keep living thanks to her children.

Gulbarg sells seeds, nuts and flatbreads. She has been doing this for about 11 years. Gulbarg has applied for a loan because she really wants to realize her dream. She has long dreamed of buying furniture for her home and has been saving up to buy it for a long time, but she still does not have enough money. Gulbarg has taken the decision to apply for a loan. She will repay the loan from her business. Gulbarg believes that she will definitely get support. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy the furniture of her dreams.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia never finished high school but she has always had a strong mind and engaging ‎personality. Sofia opened a mini-market in her home for the neighborhood and school ‎children.‎ She needs this loan for stock and new products.‎

Sofia wants to continue her mini-market and wants to introduce new products. Mostly she ‎wants to make sure her children and grandchildren complete high school and gain an ‎advanced degree.‎

loans.use: to purchase stock and new products for her mini-market

loans.name: 04020709Phố Lai Thành-P.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Dung has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine and cloth to maintain her tailoring shop.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main challenge that she faces is a lack of capital.

Dung is 39 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 04020709Phố Lai Thành-P.Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2014, Dung joined the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa.

With her business profits, Dung hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase a machine and cloth to maintain her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Xiengxien Group

texts.en:
Davone understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Davone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Davone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Davone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come. Children pictured are children of borrowers in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonsong Group

texts.en:
Bong is the leader of this seven-member group. Her village gets much of its drinking water from local wells, streams and rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without boiling it.

Bong and her group are now applying for a 3,850,000 LAK loan through Kiva's field partner TerraClear Development to buy TerraClear water filters for each member. The filters are guaranteed for two years. The group is glad that the filters are available on a payment plan that makes them much more affordable.

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now Bong and the others can shift to other pursuits. The villagers also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families’ budgets. Bong’s family will realize a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs through the use of its filter.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, nails and wood to continue improving the roof of his home.

loans.name: Nhóm 02-Phố 6-P.đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Lân is 52 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She also is the leader of the Nhóm 02-Phố 6-P.Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members.

For the past ten years Lân has operated a stall where she serves prepared food. Her main obstacle to her business is her lack of capital to develop it further.

In 2010, Lân joined Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa to improve her business. She has successfully repaid six loans from the organization. She is now requesting a 30,000,000 VND loan to be apportioned among the group members. With her share Lân will buy more ingredients for food to be sold from her stall.

Lân is working to gradually develop her business. She would like to refurbish her house and wishes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food to be sold from her stall.

loans.name: 03 Chiến Thắng Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Vệ is applying for a loan to purchase seafood to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling sea food.

Vệ is 45 years old and she is married with two children. Vệ is the group leader of the 03 Chiến Thắng Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2010, Vệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Vệ has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Vệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Vệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to resell

loans.name: Nanam Group

texts.en:
Lai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Lai and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. 

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits. Lai and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. 

The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within these two years, filter users, like Lai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marguba

texts.ru: Маргуба, 36 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, с супругом ведут семейный бизнес - столовую, автомойку, баню. Бизнес развит, услуги пользуются большим спросом, так как находятся в проходимых местах. В столовой Маргубы работают 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку плиты для столовой, столовых приборов, посуды. Количество клиентов растет и их нужно обслуживать. Будущие доходы от кредита Маргуба планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Marguba is 36 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a secondary education, and runs a family business with her husband: a canteen, car wash, and bath house. The business is well developed, and the services are in great demand since they are situated in high traffic areas. Two people work in Marguba's canteen. In order to further develop her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy an oven for the canteen, cutlery, and dishes. The number of clients is growing and they need to be served. Marguba plans to invest the future proceeds of the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy an oven, cutlery, and dishes for her canteen.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Minlasag, Sibutad, industriously caring for her fishing activities. She is married and has two children. She personally takes charge of their business and is doing well. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses; sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman.

Now Judith sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 12,000 loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

She deeply wishes for a good education for her children and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Naterk Group

texts.en: Xiengthongkham’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Xiengthongkham and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Xiengthongkham and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Xiengthongkham’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and iron, to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Lý Đông Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Thênh is applying for a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She works in agriculture raising cattle.

Thênh is 63 years old and she is married with four children. Thênh is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Thôn Lý Đông Xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 1998, Thênh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thênh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thênh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thênh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thênh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail shop where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a competitive area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a quality life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Ma. Enriquita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Enriquita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Ma. Enriquita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Ma. Enriquita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Nifrot

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Nifrot. He is a 32-year-old farmer who lives in Marioshani village in Kenya where he owns a small piece of land. He has a dairy and farms his crops. His main source of income is from milk and potatoes.

Nifrot is applying for a KES 40,000 loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo buy a dairy cow. Having an additional cow will increase Nifrot's milk supply to be taken to market and earn him extra income. He plans to use his income from the newly-acquired cow to repay his loan on time and to meet the basic needs of his young family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Элнура, 25 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Элнуры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством, выращивая рис, подсолнечник и клевер на 2,79 ГА земли. Продукция пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Элнура решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец и обработку почвы для выращивания экологически чистых риса и подсолнечника. Доходы от кредита Элнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и планирует накопить на возможность выращивания зерновых культур, так как в сельской местности это очень прибыльное дело.
texts.en:
Elnura is 25 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Elnura has a secondary education, and as the primary income source for her family, she works in field husbandry, growing rice, sunflowers, and clover on 2.79 hectares of land. 

Her products are in great demand, so Elnura decided to approach Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 10 sheep and cultivate her soil to grow organic rice and sunflowers. Elnura plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further expand her business, and plans to save so that she can grow grain, since that is a very profitable business in rural areas.

loans.use: to cultivate her land in order to grow organic rice and sunflowers, and to buy 10 sheep.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Ngọ Trung,hạ Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Quyền is applying for a loan to purchase more baby cows to raise and sell in the future. She works in agriculture raising cows.

Quyền is 51 years old and she is married with four children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Ngọ Trung, hạ Xa Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2000, Quyền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Quyền has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. 

Quyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cows to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail shop where she sells onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

She will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and onions. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

Judy's business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to give her children a good education and build a family house.

loans.use: buymore tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIOLETAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Secretaria de Actas. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas de lana, venta de zapatos, venta de salchipapa, venta de chamarras y venta de comida.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que es hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y salchicha  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo elaborará y lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.

Las señoras Katty Aduviri y Paola Escobar aparecen detrás de la señora con sombrero.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Violetas" will be starting its sixth term in Pro Mujer, part of the business center of Los Andes. It is comprised of nine members and run by a directors board where Flora is the Secretary. The members of the communal bank run a wide variety of businesses, selling  everything from wool sweaters or shoes or jackets to fried snacks and other foods.

This loan will benefit all of the small business owners in Flora's group. She herself has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years and joined at the invitation of a friend who was a client of the institution. She currently runs a business selling salchipapa, a typical snack of sausage and fried potatoes. She began this business on her own initiative.

She plans to use this loan to expand her capital through the wholesale purchase of potato and sausage, which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then use this material to make and sell salchipapa in her sales space. This work allows her to generate enough money to support her family economically, as she is single and has eight children.	

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health clinic and the training that the institution provides.

(In the photo, Katty and Paola appear behind the woman in the hat.)

loans.use: purchase food at wholesale to make and sell typical snacks

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, sugar, rice, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, soap and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier of grocery goods within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with loan SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, soap and other items

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de odontologia,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de odontologia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales para curar los dientes.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member is still a dentist, from 8am to 7pm. She has worked in this area for a number of years and all is going well for her. He dream is to expand her dentistry business. She is applying for a loan to buy toothcare products. She is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in full.

loans.use: to buy toothcare materials.

loans.name: Avispas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AVISPAS” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de papa y chuño, venta de ropa, venta de carne, venta de cosméticos y servicio de internet.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia t es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años y lo aprendió por iniciativa propia con el ahorro de un pequeño capital. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra carne  por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “Avispas” (Wasps) communal bank will be starting its sixteenth lending cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of Centro Focal de Santiago II.  The communal bank is made up of nine members and is overseen by a Board of Directors.  Señora Alicia is the president of the Board.  The communal bank's members run various businesses including food sales, potato and freeze-dried potato sales, selling clothing, selling meat, cosmetic sales and offering internet services. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small, micro-entrepreneurs, of whom señora Alicia is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago at the invitation of a friend, who is also a client of the institution.  Currently, señora Alicia has a business selling meat.  She tells us that she started the business a number of years ago with a small amount of capital that she had saved.  She learned the business on her own initiative. 

The loan that señora Alicia is taking out is to increase her capital (to purchase wholesale meat).  She will acquire the meat from merchants in El Alto and later sell it from her sales stall.  This form of work allows señora Alicia to generate an income to help her family financially.  She is married and has one son.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, señora Alicia's response is that she likes the area of health and the trainings that the institution provides.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale meat.

loans.name: 8 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “8 DE ENERO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de comida y venta de chamarras y venta de coca.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de una amiga a quien ayudaba. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de coca por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el ahorro y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 8 De Enero [8th January] are starting their third cycle with Pro Mujer, working with the organisation's regional office in Senkata. It is made up of eight members, and is managed by a board of directors of which Filomena is president. The members of this communal bank are all working to improve very different businesses, including sales of clothing, fruit, candy, soft drinks, food, jackets and coca.

The loan will benefit female micro-entrepreneurs, including Filomena. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, by invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling coca, she explains that she learned this business several years ago from a friend who was helping her.

This loan will be to increase her stock (to buy coca in bulk) which she will acquire from wholesale merchants in the city of La Paz, which she will then sell in the fairs in the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings and the healthcare that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy coca wholesale.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner continues to work selling shoes. She is an enterprising woman who, through this business, wishes to provide for her family. 

She is requesting this loan to buy shoes.

She is happy with the loan, and promises to meet the agreed repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Thái Sơn Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lương has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, and milk. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

Lương is 56 years old and she is married with three children. 

She is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Thái Sơn Xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2000, Lương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Lương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell

loans.name: Hermelin

texts.en: Hermelin, 36 years old, is married with two kids and is a resident of Ventura, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in June 2013. Recently, Hermelin decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Farming helped Felix provide for his family. He is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other crops to earn a living. For their daily needs, Felix also runs a sari-sari store business for additional earnings and survival. He finds the retailing business easy and simple because all he needs to do is display and tend his store for his buyers. 

Felix plans to expand his retailing business. He applied for a loan from PMPC for the required capital. He wants to purchase more items for his store inventory. He also wants to pay for fertilizer and compost for his farm.

Felix smiles at the thought of having a happy and comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase more items for his store inventory and to pay for fertilizer and compost for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize cereals to sell, so that she can meet family and client needs.

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 34 años, es casada tiene  tres  hijos de las edades entre 7 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
María con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de gas propano, desde hace dos años.
María solicita un préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales como cemento, cal, arena y hierro para construir una pared de su casa y comprar laminas para el techo de su casa.
El gran sueño de María es poder hacer de su negocio algo más grande y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is a 34 year old woman, is married, and has three children who are between 7 and 12 years old. This humble family lives in a community of San Pablo Jocopilas.
In an effort to make income and get her family ahead, she has made a living for the past two years selling propane gas.

María is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, lime, sand, and iron to build a wall in her house and to buy sheeting for her roof. María’s dream is to grow her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Thamee Group

texts.en:
Kuang knows the difference her water filter will make for her and the Thamee group’s families. The villagers now boil the water they get from local natural sources before drinking it. Boiling water also consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Kuang is buying is guaranteed for two years. It will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money, time and cost spent in foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to buy bottled water if it is available.

Kuang is excited about the filter’s easy payment plan and the many benefits clean water will bring to the villagers for many months to come.

loans.use: to buy a TerraClear water filter so she can have safe drinking water.

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru:
Шахринисо милая, улыбчивая учительница средней школы. Она работает швеей у себя дома.  Создавая каждое платье Шахринисо ложит частичку своей души. Она любит тем чем она занимается ни не капельки не жалеет, что выбрала именно эту деятельность. В жизни Шахринисо есть 3 человека. Это ее сын, невестка и новорожденный внук. Шахринисо потеряла своего мужа и именно ее близкие смогли ей помочь поправиться от этого горя. 
Шахринисо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Они начали ремонт, но не хватило средств, чтобы завершить. Ее семье сейчас тяжело жить в руинах и они срочно ищут средства, так как у них маленький ребенок и они думают прежде всего о нем.  Шахринисо видит выход из данного положения только в кредите. Поддержите Шахринисо.
texts.en:
Shahriniso is a sweet, always-smiling secondary school teacher. She works as a seamstress from her home. Shahriniso puts a piece of her own soul into the making of every dress. She so loves what she does that she never regrets, even a little bit, choosing this occupation. Shahriniso has three people in her life: her son, his wife, and her newborn grandson. Shahriniso lost her husband, and these people close to her were able to help her recover from her grief.

Shahriniso has applied for a loan to repair her house. Her family began the repairs, but did not have the funds to complete them. They currently live in ruins, and they urgently seek the funds, as they have a small baby and think about him before all other things. Shahriniso sees a loan as the only way out of their current circumstances. Support Shahriniso.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es: Marvin tiene la edad de 50 años, esta casado y actualmente tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. el con el crédito va comprar los insumos para sus siembras de maíz, frijol y ayote. El va comprar una parte en semilla, abonos y todo tipo de plaguicidas. Ademas cuenta con terrenos aptos para la explotación de estos cultivos y posee muchos años de experiencia en esta cosas por lo cual opto por sembrar una mayor cantidad que años anteriores. El pretende con esta mejoras y ayuda a sus siembras poder mejorar la producción en cantidad y calidad para así a su vez obtener mejores resultados que los anteriores. El espera poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida para tiempos futuros. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y nunca antes había tenido créditos en otros bancos.
texts.en: 50-year-old Marvin is married with 4 children, who are his number one priority. He will use the loan to buy supplies for his corn, bean and squash crops. He intends to buy seeds, manure and all types of pesticides. He also owns land which is suitable for growing these crops and he has many years off experience in the job and so he decided to sow larger quantities than he had in previous years. He hopes to make these improvements to boost his production in terms of both quantity and quantity and, as a result, have better results than in previous years.  he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life in the future. This is the second time he has applied for a loan and he had never before had any loans from other banks.

loans.use: to buy supplies with which to look after his crops

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 50 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida lo cual se esfuerzan para tener el sustento del hogar, por lo que son muy trabajadores. Gladis se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante desde hace 10 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y su amabilidad cada día son más las personas que tienden a comprar sus productos porque les brinda precios accesibles. Gladis desea comprar un vehículo para transportarse con su mercadería para poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos ya que las zonas que visita son peligrosas y de difícil acceso  y con el vehículo podrá acceder más fácil, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en un vehículo para transportar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Gladis is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse.  They work hard to sustain their home and are very hard working people.  Gladis works as a traveling salesperson of clothing and has done so for ten years.  Thanks to her experience and disposition, every day she has more people who purchase her products because she offers reasonable prices.  

Gladis wants to purchase a vehicle to transport herself and her merchandise in order to offer a better selection of products.  The areas she visits are dangerous and difficult to access.  With the vehicle she will be able to access those areas more easily, which is why she is asking for the loan from FUSAI to invest in a vehicle to transport her goods.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to transport her goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy building materials to pave the hall of his home

loans.name: Telma Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Telma se dedica a la crianza de pollos y gallinas, además tiene una venta de frutas en el mercado municipal, es madre de tres niños y por ellos es que junto a su esposo están luchando para darle lo mejor a sus hijos ya que el mayor esta en tercero primaria y por ello es que ha solicitado su crédito para invertir más en pollos para la crianza y así obtener ganancias y darle estudio a sus hijos hasta que lleguen a graduarse, tiene buen record crediticio. Agradece el apoyo que le brindaron hace un año y se sigue comprometiendo a ser responsable en sus pagos y así poder recibir siempre el apoyo de kiva y fape.
texts.en: Telma works raising chicks and hens; in addition, she sells fruit in the municipal market. She is the mother of three children, and it is for them that together she and her husband struggle to provide the best for their children. The oldest is in the third year of primary school and for this, she is asking for a loan to invest in more chicks to raise them and in this way get earnings and provide her children with an education until they graduate. She has a good credit record. She is grateful for the support that was offered to her a year ago, and she is still committed to being responsible in her payments and in this way to be able to always get the support of Kiva and FAPE.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Caleb Grover

texts.es:
Caleb es un joven hombre de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de Contabilidad General. 
Él es inteligente, responsable, comprometido, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Sus estudios los realiza en un instituto técnico de educación comercial, ubicado en la zona ‘San Pedro’, situada al oeste de la ciudad, zona central caracterizada por encontrarse la cárcel de reclusión. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/14 grados centígrados.
Caleb es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no utiliza porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes y con su hermano mayor que trabaja, viven en una casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de contaduría general y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los procesos numéricos de las cuentas, su carácter es de servicio, “tengo muchos deseos de terminar mis estudios para poder trabajar en mi rubro…” comenta. paralelamente a sus estudios él trabaja como chofer en su auto propio. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de computadora. Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un buen empleo y desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil.  Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica al estudio profesional y trabaja.
