Es por esos motivos que Caleb solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para terminar su carrera profesional y trabajar en su rubro.
texts.en:
Caleb is a 21-year-old young man, single, with no children, and is studying general accounting. 

He is intelligent, responsible, dedicated, reliable, patient, responsible and very hard-working. He is studying at a technical institute of business education, located in the San Pedro area, situated to the west of the city, in a central zone characterized by having the prison. It has a cold and dry climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between -1 and 14 degrees centigrade.

Caleb has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, with a thin physique, his native language is Aymará, which he doesn't use because he studies and lives in the city. He has his life with his parents who work as businesspeople and with his younger brother who works. They live in a house they own, which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. He is studying the general accounting program and is in year 2 of the 5 years that the program lasts. He enjoys helping people, he likes to understand the numerical processes of bills. He is service-oriented. "I have a lot of desire to finish my education to be able to work in my field..." he says. At the same time that he goes to school, he works as a driver in his own car. The advantage of his activities are that the hours don't overlap, the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy a laptop. His dream is to be a professional to get a good job and he wants to purchase a laptop. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that he has been studying a profession and working. 

For these reasons, Caleb asks for a loan to purchase a laptop to finish his professional program and work in his field.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to finish his professional degree and work in his field.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Karla Sofia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte lugar  conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
Aquí vive la señora Karla, tiene 29 años  de edad y es soltera.  Ella vive en casa de los padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante, razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que la ayudan para que ella pueda recibir el crédito.
Doña Karla trabaja en las oficinas de una cooperativa de trasporte interprovincial, pero para lograr mejores ingresos ella  también vende zapatillas y ropa  por catalogo así como también productos de Avon y  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas),  vende en sus ratos libres, en su lugar de trabajo o  en su casa,  sus ventas son muy buenas ya que cuenta con buena clientela, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 1 año  que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo y así ayudar a sus padres con los gastos. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatillas, perfumes, cremas y otros productos que vende. Sus sueños son tener un  buen local.
texts.en:
The credit group Amigas Trabajadoras meet every fortnight in the Rocafuerte canton, a place known for the great variety of sweets made here and are renowned throughout the country for their delicious flavor.

This is where Karla lives. She is 29, single and lives in her parents home. 

She has been through three cycles with this credit group, which she likes as the loans allow her to get ahead, which is why she is so grateful for the foundation and the people who help so that she can receive the loan.

Karla works in the offices of an interprovincial transport cooperative, to increase her income she also sells slippers and clothing by catalog, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies accessories), she sells in her free time, at work or at home, her sales are very good as she has good customers. She sells on credit, and collects payment every eight days. She has been doing this for a year, which allows her to earn her living, and help her parents with the costs.

This loan will be to buy clothing, slippers, perfumes, creams, and other products that she sells.
 
Her dream is to have good premises.

loans.use: to buy clothing, slippers, perfumes, creams. etc.

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en:
Ursulina lives in Poblacion, Sibutad, Philippines, and is married with three children. She helps her husband, who is a carpenter, with the income of her manicure business. 

She renders her services in a house-to-house service, and because of her efficient work her customers increase. 

She became a member of Paglaum in February 2012 with a good credit standing, even if she encounters problems. Now, she applies for 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy an additional foot spa set to meet the demands of her customers, and it helps her increase her income.  

She saves a portion of her income for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy an additional foot spa set

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Stellah operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and convenient area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 40,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a parent of five children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Rosalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood, nails, and labor in order to replace her home’s roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, soft drinks and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre de 41 años de edad, casado tiene un hijo de 12 años y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, dedicado, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Pio XII’ caracterizada por ser un asentamiento de chaskis (en el tiempo del imperio inca), donde se encontraron tumbas incaicas, cerámica y piezas de oro de esa época. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1, 16 grados centígrados.
Antonio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultural general y por el comercio que realiza( de pie a la derecha, viste chamarra negra). Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera, que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, agua, azúcar, aceite, fideo, harina,  arroz, manteca, refrescos, papel, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio. Debido a la falta de comercio en el área no cuenta con competencia. Actividad que realiza de forma independiente todos los días de la semana en horario del día, “heredé el negocio de mi mamá y tengo la ventaja de compartir con mi familia y estar al lado de mi hijo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a su familia y a su hijo, la desventaja es que el espacio de trabajo es pequeño. Su sueño es abrir un mini supermercado para realizar ventas por mayor, el desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra por mayor de abarrotes y material escolar para la venta en su tienda, ya que debido a que no cuenta con competencia el negocio se desabastece rápido. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Antonio solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y material escolar para surtir su tienda y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Antonio is 41 years old, married and has a 12 years old son. He has a business selling articles and basic foods items in his neighborhood store.

He is a good father, enterprising, dedicated, persevering, patient, responsible and hard working. He carries out his business in the “Pio XII” area, known for being a settlement of the Chaskis (in the times of the Inca Empire). In this place, Inca tombs, ceramics, and pieces of gold from that era were found. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies throughout the day between -1, 16 °C 

Antonio has a dark complexion, brown eyes, black short hair, short stature and is slender. His native language is Aymará, which he uses with his family and he also speaks Spanish because of the general culture and because of the type of work he does (he is standing on the right side wearing a black jacket). He lives with his wife who works in the same business and with his son who attends school. They live in their own home build with bricks and cement, a roof of corrugated metal sheets and wood floor. They have electricity but do not have water or sewage.

He sells groceries and basic items such as: bread, water, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, rice, lard, beverages, paper, crackers, cleaning products, etc. in his neighborhood store. Because of the lack of businesses in the area he does not have competitors. He works independently every day of the week during the day hours.  “I inherited the business from my mother and I have the advantage of sharing it with my family and to be close to my son” he comments. The advantage of his business is that he can take care of his family and his son. The disadvantage is that the space he has to work in is very small. His dream is to open a mini supermarket to sell wholesale. He wants to expand his business by purchasing groceries in bulk and to buy school supplies to sell in his store. Because he does not have competitors he runs out of stock quickly. This is the 6th loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years that he has been in business.

For this reason Antonio is requesting the loan, to purchase groceries and school supplies to stock his store and with the profits, pay for his son’s school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and school supplies to stock his store and with the profits pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Serafina tiene 32 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales y venta de maiz,la socia lleva buen tiempo con sus negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Serafina, 32, belongs to the SAN JUAN DE OLLANTAYTAMBO community bank in Ollantaytambo, a district in Peru's "departamento" of Cusco.  
Serafina is single and has 2 children.  She operates a farming business, growing maize and raising small animals for sale.  She has operated the business for some time now and says that it is successful because she has put a lot of effort towards making it successful.  
Serafina is applying for a loan that she will use, among other things, to buy guinea pigs for her animal sales business.  The investment will allow her to carry on the business and provide for her family.  She is grateful for the loan, she says, and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her animal sales business.

loans.name: Doda

texts.en:
Due to financial burden, Doda and her husband work hand in hand to sustain their daily necessities. She is 57 years old, married and has seven children. 

They want to plant more vegetables and root crops, but they have insufficient capital. For this reason, Doda is asking for an additional loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides needed in their vegetable production business. 

They are hoping that this financial assistance will enable them to improve their farming business and to have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a highly populated area, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 60,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy a sewing machine and tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to employ people and have more profits within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and tailoring materials

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: These people are members of the “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank which is situated in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name. The featured member is 42-year-old Teresa, who is married with 4 children. She runs a catering business, preparing various dishes such as oven-baked chicken, soup and sautéed meat. She works from 8am to 6pm. Teresa has been running the business for a number of years and it is going very well. She now dreams of owning her own restaurant. She is applying for the loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken. The other members of the group sell sweets, clothing, groceries and books. Teresa is very grateful to those who are helping her achieve her dream in this way and she promises to make her repayments within the set time period.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Marie Honorine

texts.fr:
Honorine a 44 ans. Elle est mère de cinq enfants dont trois scolarisés actuellement. Elle est mariée mais ce mari ne la soutient pas car c'est un ivrogne et irresponsable. De ce fait, elle doit travailler dur pour assumer les devoirs et obligations parentales. 
Achat et revente des serviettes de bain est actuellement l' activité génératrice de revenu qu'elle exerce. Et pour en tirer des bénéfices supplémentaires, elle voudrait en rajoutait d'autres articles comme tee-shirts et sous-vêtements. Elle voudrait à tout prix tenir son activité en bonne marche, la développer et l'améliorer, vu sa situation.
Son objectif est de pouvoir continuer la scolarisation de ses enfants, leur offrir une condition de vie meilleur malgré tout.
texts.en:
Honorine is 44. She has five children of whom three attend school at present. She is married, but her husband does not support her because he is a drunk and an irresponsible person. Due to this, she has to work hard to cope with the duties and obligations of parenting.
At present, she works in the business of buying and selling bath towels. To make more profit, she would like to add other articles such as tee shirts and undergarments. She really wants to make her business work well, to expand it and to improve it in view of her present situation.
Her aim is to be able to continue to send her children to school and improve their living conditions in spite of their situation.

loans.use: to buy supplementary towels, tee shirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn Tây Giang Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Nga is 29 years old, and she is married with two children. Nga has a manufacturing business making bamboo furniture. She has been involved in the business for 5 years, and the main challenge that her business faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase bamboo to make furniture for sale.

Nga is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 Thôn Tây Giang Xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. In 2013, Nga joined the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Since then, Nga has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa.

With her business profits, Nga hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta De Urco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN ASUNTA DE URCO.
La socia Aurelia tiene 46 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra  de maíz entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 46, is a member of the VIRGEN ASUNTA DE URCO community bank.  She is married and operates a business making and selling chicha.  The business is successful, she says, because she has worked hard to make it a success.  
Aurelia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her retail business with maize, etc.  The investment will allow her to carry on the business and continue providing for her family.  She and the rest of the group are grateful for your loan and all are committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.  
The person in the photo whose face has been covered is not a member of the community bank.  The member in the photo at the bottom right of the larger photo asked to be excused from the group photo because he had to work.

loans.use: to buy maize for her retail business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a supportive mother of five children and is married to a contractual laborer.  In order to supplement her husband's income, she sells fruits and vegetables on house-to-house visits.  She has been doing this type of work for two years.  Evangeline is seeking a loan from Paglaum to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables.  She believes that her fruits and vegetables business helps increase her income so that she can save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Esperanza Sofia

texts.es: Día tras día Esperanza de 47 años, alquila a sus vecinos lavadoras para facilitarles sus labores en el hogar, esta emprendedora mujer deseaba tener su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos, sus hermanas le ayudaron a pensar en una oportunidad y consideraron que un alquiler de lavadoras podría ser una buena alternativa, así que ella decidió poner en marcha su sueño de prosperidad y adquirió sus primeras lavadoras por medio de un crédito que le otorgaron.  Hoy en día cuenta con  dos años de funcionamiento en el barrio donde reside al sur de Barranquilla y sus vecinos pueden rentar estos electrodomésticos todos los días a partir de las 6 a.m. a 6 p.m.  Esperanza es muy comprometida y responsable, hasta tal punto que ha obtenido excelentes resultados, la demanda cada día es mayor por ello en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de otras lavadoras.  Esperanza es madre de un hijo a quien desea continuar apoyándole en sus estudios.  A futuro desea haber ampliado mucho más la cobertura de su negocio y continuar surgiendo.
texts.en:
Day after day, Esperanza, aged 47, rents washing machines to her neighbours to help them make their household chores easier.

This enterprising woman wanted to have her own business and increase her income. Her sisters helped her think about business opportunities and considered that a washing machine rental business could be a good option. So she decided to set her prosperity dream in motion and took a loan to acquire her first washing machines.  

It's been two years since she set up her business in her neighbourhood, in the south of Barranquilla. Her neighbours can rent these appliances from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day.

Esperanza is a very committed and responsible woman, and she has obtained excellent results. The demand for renting washing machines is increasing each day. For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan—her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo—to purchase more washing machines.

Esperanza has a son, and she wants to keep on supporting his schooling. 

She plans to expand her business in the future and continue with her success.

loans.use: to buy more washing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of secondhand clothing for sale for more income gain.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура выражает свою благодарность за Вашу поддержку. Она очень рада, что есть человек, который поддерживает ее в любое время. Сейчас Манзура продает только детскую одежду. Она любить торговую деятельность. Этой деятельностью ей  нравится ежедневный доход, и помочь клиентам выбирать качественную и хорошую одежду для детей. Манзура планирует за счет кредита,  привозит осеннюю одежду, и увеличить товарооборот. Ее доходы только от этой деятельности.  Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и доходы от торговли. Вы можете поддержать ее! Манзура верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Manzura expresses her gratitude for your support. She is very glad that there is someone who will support her at any time. Now Manzura sells only children's clothing. She loves trading. What she likes about this business is the daily income, and helping clients to choose high quality, good clothes for children. Manzura plans to bring in autumn clothing using the loan, and to increase her stock. Her income comes only from this business. The requested loan will help her to increase her stock and her income from trading. You can support her! Manzura believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to bring in autumn clothing and increase her stock.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.ru:
Биби 54 летняя сильная и активная женщина. Биби мастерица швеи. Услуга швеи является основным источником дохода для Биби. Шить и кроить для ее доставляет много удовольствий. Она шьет платья на заказ на машинке, на которой Вы видите на фотографии. Биби опытная и талантливая швея. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход, и сшить больше одежды. 
Биби имеет трое дочери. Они уже взрослые, и им 33,29 и 25 лет. Она вместе семьей живет на районе Восе. Биби собирается отремонтировать свой дом. У нее осталось одна комната без ремонта, и она хочет завершить ремонт. Биби просит кредит, для покупки стройматериалы для ремонта. Она будет рада на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bibi is a strong and active 54-year-old woman. She is a master seamstress. Bibi's services as a seamstress are her primary source of income, and cutting out and sewing items gives her great pleasure. She sews dresses to order using the sewing machine that you can see in the picture. She is an experienced and talented seamstress. She likes that being a seamstress gives her a daily income, and particularly likes sewing clothing.

Bibi has three daughters. They are already grown, and are 33, 29, and 25 years old. They live with their families in the Vose region. Bibi is getting ready to repair her house. She has one room left that needs to be repaired, and she wants to finish the repairs. Bibi is requesting a loan for the purchase of building materials for the repairs. She will be happy to have your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a flatbed sewing machine to maintain the quality of his footwear

loans.name: Doris Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Doris Jovita  se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza ceviches que es un plato a base de pescado y limon acompañados de camote, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pescado,limon y camotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Doris Jovita, operates a food sales business.  She makes and sells ceviche, a traditional dish made with seafood and lemon, often served with yams.  She generally works from 8:00am to 6:00pm.  Doris Jovita has operated the business for 8 years and is pleased with her progress.  She hopes, she says, to open a restaurant one day.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to buy supplies--seafood, lemon, yams--to carry on her business.  

Doris Jovita is glad of the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de confección de muebles, el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar melanina.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Juan Carlos, operates a furniture-making business.  He works hard at the business because it is his means of supporting his family.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy melanin, an engineered material like plywood.  

Juan Carlos is glad of the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Oumou est celle  debout au bout avec la daba en main sur la photo.

Agée de 43 ans, Oumou est une femme mariée qui vit dans une commune rurale au Mali avec son mari cultivateur et ses 2 enfants âgés de 3  et 7 ans dont 1 scolarisé. 
Son activité consiste à acheter les intrants, semences, engrais et pesticides plus frais de laboure pour la culture d’arachide qui est une activité très rentable dans la zone.
Les fonds qu’elle a reçu de l’institution serviront à payer  les frais de laboure et de sarclage de son champs et l’achat des intrants. 
Pour bien exercer cette activité, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché local et  y  revend  ses  produits.
Oumou est ambitieuses, elle rêve assurer le bien-être de ses enfants et l’épanouissement de la famille (nourriture suffisante et habitat amélioré) à travers les profits que génère son champs.
Elle est analphabète et pauvre raison pour laquelle elle contracte le prêt avec le RMCR, avec 3 cycles d’hivernages de la culture d’arachide elle n’a rencontré aucun problème.
texts.en:
Oumou is the person standing in the photo, holding the axe. She is 43. She lives in a rural community in Mali with her husband, a farmer, and her two children who are aged three and seven. One of them goes to school.
Her business is buying products for the earth, seeds, fertiliser and pesticides plus the labour costs for growing groundnut which has become a very profitable activity in the area.
The funds that she has received from the institution will be used to pay for labour costs for hoeing her field, and for buying products for the earth.
To do this work well, she buys her supplies at the big local market, and resells her products there.
Oumou is ambitious. She dreams of seeing her children well and happy, and her family flourishing (sufficient food and improved habitat) through the profits that she makes from her fields.
She is illiterate and poor, which is why she took this loan with RMCR. With three winter cycles of farming groundnuts, she has not come up against any problems.

loans.use: to buy products for the earth and to pay costs for labour and for hoeing.

loans.name: Inka Raqay De Chahuaytire Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal INKA RAQAY DE CHAHUAYTIRE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Pisaq, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ana María  tiene 40 años de edad  y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de prendas de vestir (artesanía),la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas de colores entre otros.
Los socios  se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 40, is a member of the INKA RAQAY DE CHAHUAYTIRE community bank in Pisaq, a district in Peru's "departamento" of Cusco.
Ana Maria is single.  She operates a business making and selling traditional clothing.  She is a hard-working and tenacious woman who has operated her business for several years now.  The business is a success, she says, because she has worked hard to make it a success.  She hopes to carry on the business because it is her means of supporting her family. 
Ana Maria is applying for a loan that she will use to buy wool in different colors.  She and the rest of the group are grateful for the loan and all are committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.  
The two members in the small photo at the bottom left of the larger photo asked to be excused from the group photo because they had to work.

loans.use: to buy wool in different colors for her weaving business.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liliana Sulema ella es soltera y tiene 25 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos,la socia tambien trabaja para pagar sus estudios universitarios y vendiendo ropa sale adelante,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora por eso la socia trabaja y tambien estudia, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: These people are members of the “LAS FLORES”; communal bank, which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name. The featured member is Liliana Sulema who is 25 years old and single. She sells clothing for a living: trousers, blouse and polo shirts. She also works to pay her university fees and supports herself by selling clothing. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman as she works and studies at the same time. She has already been running this business for a number of years and she is doing vey well. Her dream is to have a bazaar. Liliana is applying for the loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, jumpers and blouses. The other members of the group have businesses which involve running a restaurant, selling clothing, selling groceries and selling food. Liliana is grateful to all those who are helping her to achieve her dream in this way and she promises to repay the loan within the set time period.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, jumpers and blouses.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia Lidia  se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales,como quinua,cebada, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Lidia, makes a living selling cereals such as quinoa, barley, and wheat, among others. With this business, she wishes to move forward. The member's dream is to expand her grain sale business.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, barley, and wheat. The member is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: 040613020002 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hà has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to resell. Hà, 45 years old, is married and has 2 children. She is the group leader of the 040613020002 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hà has been involved in her business for 6 years. Her main business hardship is lack of capital. With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, 31 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Aileen works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 2 years, Aileen has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. to sell. In the future, Aileen would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cristóbal Silva

texts.es:
Cristóbal es conocido por el esfuerzo en su trabajo y por el crecimiento que ha tenido gracias a su desempeño como agricultor y ganadero. Ahora con más de treinta años de experiencia en esta rama, siente que los préstamos con MiCrédito a través de Kiva le han ayudado para desarrollarse. Por esta razón se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le apoyaron en el préstamo anterior, con el que compró zacate y pagó a sus trabajadores. 
Ahora está en una etapa donde desea invertir en algo muy importante en su negocio de ganadería, puesto que las vacas han aumentado. Por esta razón, Cristóbal solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar gallinaza o cualquier alimento para las vacas, además alambre para reparar la cerca del potrero.  Con esto podrá controlar mejor su ganado, mantenerlo y mejorar la calidad del producto.  Al cancelar pretende solicitar un nuevo préstamo para pagar a trabajadores en el nuevo corte de zacate.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is known for his hard-work and for the growth he's achieved thanks to his performance as a farmer and cattle rancher. He has more than 30 years of experience in this field. He feels the loans from MiCrédito through Kiva have helped him to expand. For this he feels most grateful for all of the people who supported him with the previous loan, which he used to purchase feed and pay his workers. 

He's now in a stage where he wants to invest in something very important for his cattle ranching business, as the cows have grown. For this reason, Cristóbal requests a new loan to purchase fertilizer and feed for the cows. With this he can better control his earnings, as well as maintain and improve the quality of the product. Upon repayment he intends to request a new loan to pay the workers who cut the hay to feed the cattle.

loans.use: Comprar gallinaza o cualquier alimento y alambre.

loans.name: Maria Montserrat

texts.es:
Maria tiene 44 años y vive con su esposo en Jalisco, la ciudad de los rodeos, el mariachi, tequila y muchas de las tradiciones que en el mundo son asociadas con México. Desde hace cinco años es maestra de inglés desde su casa. Ella ayuda a todas las personas a aprender el idioma gracias a la pedagogía y la teoría de las inteligencias múltiples. Maria conoce y analiza a todos sus estudiantes para que de acuerdo a sus habilidades pueda enseñarles de una manera divertida y efectiva. 
“Monsa”, como sus amigos la llaman, inició este negocio porque quiere que todas las personas tengan el mejor desarrollo académico y estén preparados para dar lo mejor de ellos al mundo. Un préstamo de MXN 5,000 le ayudará a comprar un pizarrón, gises, libros y papelería para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Maria está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas por confiar en ella. Con este préstamo ella será capaz de incrementar sus ganancias, con las que podrá realizar pagos satisfactorios en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and lives with her husband in Jalisco, the city of rodeos, mariachis, tequila and many of the traditions in the world that are associated with Mexico. For five years she has been an English teacher from her house. She helps everyone learn the language through pedagogy and the theory of multiple intelligences. Maria knows and analyzes all students according to their abilities and teaches in a fun and effective way.
"Monsa" as her friends call her, started this business because she wants everyone to have the best academic development and be prepared to give their best to the world. A loan of MXN 5,000 will help her buy a blackboard, chalk, books and stationery to provide better service. Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders for trusting her. With this loan she will be able to increase her profits with which she can make payments on her first successful Konfio loan.

loans.use: to buy a blackboard, books and stationery.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina, 35, is a mother of two children, both in school. She lives in Pursat province. The family's sources of income for the past fifteen years have come from growing rice on two hectares of farmland and working on other farms. Due to lack of funds, Sina is leading a group of three to apply for a loan via VisionFund to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family’s living conditions and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a married father of three, describes himself as honest. He has been operating a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, soap, milk, bread and other items for four years. His enterprise is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are locals. Insufficient working capital is his biggest challenge. 

His previous loan repaid, Peter will use this Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. His business goal is to open a mini supermarket within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items

loans.name: Dúo En Victoria De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Dúo En Victoria de San Lorenzo está integrado por doña Virginia de 38 años quien se dedica a la elaboración de pan y a la venta del mismo desde hace 10 años y también distribuye pan en su comunidad ella solicita nuevamente su crédito para la compra de un cilindro para amasar el pan ya que esto les ayudaría bastante a poder ahorrar más tiempo y les ayudara a poder elaborar más pan ella actualmente cuenta con 2 empleados que elaboran el pan y también cuenta con personas que le ayudan a la venta de pan posee un pequeño local donde se dedica a la venta de pan su mayor sueño es poder abrir un local en el centro de su comunidad para la venta de pan y también de refacciones ya desea agrandar un poco mas sus negocio y tener una mejor vida para ofrecer a sus hijos.
texts.en: Virginia, 38, is a member of the Duo En Victoria de San Lorenzo community bank.  She has operated a business making and selling bread for 10 years.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a kitchen tool for kneading dough.  The investment will allow her to do more work in less time.  Virginia has 2 employees who make bread and she contracts with other people to distribute her bread around the town.  She also has a small shop where her customers can come to buy bread from her directly.  For the future, she would like to open a shop in the center of town where she can sell bread and other baked goods.  She wants to grow her business so that she can build a better life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment for her bakery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 39 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 3 y 21 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Ana para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella desde hace 12 años se dedica  a esta labor.
Ana con el deseo de superarse y mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar más mercaderías como güipiles, cortes, fajas y suéteres para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Ana es poder comprar más terrenos para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old. She is married and has a beautiful family of seven children, whose ages range from three to twenty-one. This humble family lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj. In order to make her own income and help her husband with their household expenses, Ana works buying and selling traditional clothing. She has been in this business for twelve years.

Eager to improve herself and increase her income, Ana has decided to apply for a loan to buy more merchandise like traditional graments, dresses, sashes, and sweaters to meet her customers' needs.

Ana's biggest dream is to be able to buy more land so that her children can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Villa Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA QUIQUIJANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quiquijana perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis

La socia es la Sra. Martina ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara platos como sopas,saltados de carnes y pollos al horno, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal Villa Quiquijana.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "VILLA QUIQUIJANA." This bank is located in the Quiquijana district, which is in the Quispicanchis province. 

The member called Martina is single, 51 years old and has 5 children. She works in her restaurant where she makes dishes such as soup, sautéed meat and roast chicken. She is an enterprising woman who wants to use her business to help allow her children to finish their education. Her dream is to have a large restaurant. She is asking for this loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

The person in the picture whose face has been covered, no longer belongs to the communal bank, Villa Quiquijana.

The other members work selling animals, selling grain, running a grocery store and running a restaurant. 

Martina thanks those who form a part of this dream by this means and she promises to make her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia Eliana pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de crianza gallinas y chanchos, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Eliana solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas entre otros.
La socia está contenta por ser cliente y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eliana belongs to the VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA community bank.  She makes a living raising and selling chickens and pigs.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is a success because she has worked hard to make it a success.  She wants to carry on the business because it is her means of helping her family.
Eliana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy chickens, etc.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de elaboración y venta de panes, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo los panes a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como azúcar, mantequilla entre otros.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA community bank.  She operates a bakery business, making and selling bread.  She is a responsible and tenacious woman and says that she wants to carry on her business because it is her means of helping her family.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.
Our member will use the loan to buy the supplies that she needs--sugar, butter, etc.--to carry on her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has two children. He operates a garage where he offers welding and vehicle repair services. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. 

James describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy garage tools. His business goal is to open other business branches within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy garage tools

loans.name: Maria Isamar

texts.es:
Maria tiene 19 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con sus padres, cónyuge e hija en una comunidad tranquila donde la gente se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, cuyes, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, patos, gallinas, pavos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old. She lives in her family home with her parents, her spouse and her daughter, in a peaceful community where people work in commerce, livestock and farming. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

She raises and sells animals such as chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, and more. She has done this activity for 3 years, so she has experience in the business and good personal and work references in her district.  The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as pigs, ducks, chickens, turkey and more. This is to increase her business inventory. With this, she hopes to offer a larger quantity of animals to her customers, which will allow her to improve her level of income and therefore her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as pigs, ducks, chickens, turkeys and more, in order to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jessa is 41 years old and three of her children are in school.

Jessa has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items  like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jessa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jessa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish and other marine products to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish and other marine products to sell

loans.name: Mtendere Group

texts.en:
Elida is a married lady, age 32, and a custodian of four children and one orphan. She survives by selling electrical appliances in her area, together with her family members. She needs this loan to increase her business by buying other important appliances such as DVDs, bulbs and sockets, which are often demanded by people in her community.

Elida's main aim in obtaining the loan is to send her children to school and provide them with basic needs. After successfully doing business, her desire is to open another shop and build a house for her family. Since she started obtaining the loans, there has been a positive change in her life, and she is now able to provide sufficient food for her children.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances to sell

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
L’homme qui a la main sur le bœuf est M’baré sur la photo.
Agé de 58 ans M’barè est agriculteur vivant dans une commune rurale au mali avec son épouse ménagère et ses 5 enfants, scolarisé ; ils sont âgés de 3 à 6 ans. 
L’activité d’agriculture de M’barè c’est acheté les animaux maigres, les engraissés et les revendre, en plus la culture d’arachide. Pour la pratique de son activité, il s’approvisionne au marché local et fait sa vente au comptant au grand marché. 
Le financement reçu de RMCR est investi dans l’achat de bœufs maigre pour l’embouche.
Il exerce cette activité depuis   15 ans, il souhaitera assurer l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille surtout à l’éducation, la santé et nourriture suffisante pour les enfants. Il est analphabète et se sert les revenus de son embouche pour faire face à ses propres besoins et de ses enfants. Le rêve de développer son embouche lui pousse à contracter le prêt auprès du RMCR, M’barè  constate souvent la mévente des bœufs.
texts.en:
The man with his hand on the steer in the photo is Mr. M'baré.
He is 58, and he is a farmer who lives in a rural community in Mali with his wife, who is a housewife, and his five children who are between three and six. All of them go to school.
Mr. M'baré buys thin animals and fattens them up for resale and grows groundnut. To run his business, he buys his supplies at the local market and sells his merchandise for cash at the big market. He will use the funds from the RMCR loan to buy thin steers for fattening.
He has been in this business for 15 years, he would like to ensure an improvement in living conditions for his family, and especially an education, healthcare and sufficient food for his children. He is illiterate, and uses the income from fattening his livestock to provide for his needs and those of his children. The dream of developing his business pushed him to take this loan from RMCR. M'baré has noticed that his steers often sell below their value.

loans.use: to buy thin cows and fatten them up for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VALLECITO”.
La socia es la  Sra. Rosa,  la socia  tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo ,los  socios se comprometen para la siguiente foto salir completos.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “Vallecito” communal bank.  The member, Rosa, is 33 years old.  She is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  Rosa alternates her daily activities with managing her grocery store. She has been in business for some time, and it is going well thanks to her daily efforts.  Rosa wishes to continue working in order to support her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, sugar, and other items.
The members are grateful for and appreciate the support offered through this medium, and promise to pay their debts according to the established terms. The members who appear in the attached photos asked permission to be late for the meeting because of work.  They promise that the next photo will be complete.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena  se dedica al negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Maria Elena, makes a living selling hardware. The member sells nails, paints, and wires. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She has been in this business for several years, and she does very well. The member's dream is to expand her hardware sale business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy nails, paints, and wires. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy nails, paints, and wires.

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Visctoria ella es soltar y tiene 37 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

El socio que está pegado a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Visctoria, 37, belongs to the WINAY KURY community bank in Quispicanchis, a region in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  
Visctoria operates a retail grain business, buying and selling maize, wheat, quinoa, etc.  She generally works from 8:00am to 5:00pm.  She has operated the business for several years and says that she is pleased with her progress.  For the future, she would like to open a shop of her own.  For now, she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with maize, wheat, and quinoa.  
The member in the small photo at the top right of the larger photo asked to be excused from the group photo because he had to work.  
The members of the community bank operate various businesses: snack sales; clothing sales; a corner grocery; a school supplies store.  
Visctoria is grateful for this means of supporting her business and committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her retail grain business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia se dedica al negocio de venta de pescado, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pescado. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pescado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alicia works in the fish selling business. Through this business, she wants to get her family ahead. Her dream is to expand the fish selling business. She is asking for the loan to buy fish.  

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity through the application of modern farming technologies, especially greenhouse planting

loans.name: Dúo Dios Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: Dúo Dios es Mi Pastor este grupo esta conformado por la señora Hortencia de 49 años de edad, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos,le da gracias a Dios porque su negocio se a ido mejorando dia con dia, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de tejidos tipicos para vender ya que tiene muchos pedido de sus clientes y no les quiere quedar mal, espera que le puedan seguir apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en: Hortencia, 49, is member of the “Dúo Dios es Mi Pastor” communal bank.  For several years, she has been engaged in making and selling traditional fabric.  She thanks God because her business has been improving day by day.  At this time, she is requesting this loan to purchase traditional fabric to sell because she has many customer orders, and she doesn’t want to make a bad impression.  She hopes that you can continue supporting her in her business.

loans.use: to make and sell traditonal fabric.

loans.name: Maria Lucy

texts.es:
La socia Maria Lucy al banco comunal VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA.
 La socia continua dedicándose al  negocio de panadería donde produce diferentes tipos de pan, la socia  lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo los panes a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como azúcar, mantequilla entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Lucy is a member of the VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA community bank.  She operates a business making and selling different kinds of bread.  She has operated the business for several years and says that it is successful because she has worked hard to make it a success.  She is a responsible and tenacious woman and says that she wants to carry on the business because it is her means of helping her family.
Maria Lucy is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--sugar, butter, etc.--to carry on her business.  She is grateful, she says, for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
An lives in Pursat province. She is a 53-year-old mother of three children. She has been a fruit seller for more than five years, and this business earns her about 68,500 KHR per day. 

An lacks funds to renovate her old house, so she decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to fulfill her needs. She hopes through this loan her family will have a better house to live in and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

loans.name: Sonia Adriana

texts.es: Sonia nació en 1972 en Coyoacán, un sitio con alta concentración de cultura y turismo, tanto nacional como internacional. Hoy Sonia tiene 43 años, está casada y es madre de tres niños. Desde hace un año decidió convertirse en una mujer emprendedora. Comenzó un negocio vendiendo ropa y zapatos por catálogo. Es una mujer muy perseverante que siempre busca la manera de tener un ingreso extra para poder ofrecerles lo mejor a sus hijos. Planea llevar su negocio a un establecimiento más formal. Por esa razón está solicitando un préstamo de MXN 10,000, para cubrir los pedidos del Día de las Madres. No hay cosa que una madre prefiera que un regalo que pueda usar a diario. Este es su primer préstamo con Konfío y está muy comprometida a estar en tiempo en las fechas de pago. Sonia está muy agradecida con Kiva, Konfío y los prestamistas que la apoyen en este proyecto, que le permitirá ser dueña de su propia casa, misma que será parte del legado que le deje a sus hijos.
texts.en: Sonia was born in 1972 in Coyocan, a city with high concentration of culture and tourism, as national as international. Today, Sonia is 43 years old, is married, and is a mother of three kids. A year ago, she decided to become an entrepreneur. She began her business selling clothes and shoes from a catalog. She is a very persistent woman that always looks for a way of getting extra income to offer the best to her kids. She plans on raising her business to a more formal establishment. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of MXN 10,000 to cover the requests for Mother's Day. There isn't anything that a mother prefers more than a gift that she can use daily. This is her first loan with Konfio, and she is very committed to being on time in her repayment dates. Sonia is very thankful to Kiva, Konfio, and the lenders that are helping her on this project that will enable her to fulfill her dream of her own house, that will be part of the legacy that she leaves her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes in order to cover Mother's Day orders.

loans.name: As'ad

texts.en:
As'ad is a 27-year-old single man from a Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a small house. He works in a public sector. As'ad would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the necessities.

As'ad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will help him to provide hot water for the family house without using electricity. As'ad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through application of modern farming technology to earn more income so as to improve family living standards.

loans.name: Keang's Group

texts.en: A 64-year-old mother of five children and only one of them is in school, living in Pursat province, Keang is a rice and Chinese noodle seller. She has been involved in this business for twenty five years and it earns her about 54,700KHR per day. She is now leading a small group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more rice and Chinese noodle for resale and she will take the rest of money to renovate her old house. She hopes to earn more income and have a better house to stay.

loans.use: to buy more rice and Chinese noodle for resale

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
Maria tiene 36 años y vive en Cuautitlán Izcalli, un municipio que forma parte del Valle de México. Es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 8 años. Con el fin de darle una mejor vida a su hijo hace 4 años, además de empleo administrativo en una empresa, inició un negocio vendiendo comida. 
Maria es una mujer ambiciosa que es muy conocida en su región debido a que los platillos que ofrece tienen un sabor único y especial. Durante los últimos años ha sacrificado muchas cosas para poder darle lo mejor a su hijo, ya que ella es quien mantiene todos los gastos de su hogar. 
Está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 10,000 para pintar el espacio en el que se encuentra y comprar más mesas y sillas porque cada día tiene más clientes, así como ingredientes para preparar los platillos que a todos gustan. Cada día Maria tiene un menú diferente y es ella quien cocina y atiende a los clientes. 
Al apoyar a Maria, ayudarás a que mejore su servicio, incrementando sus ventas y ganancias, mismas que le permitirán ahorrar para que su hijo tengo un mejor futuro. Este es el primer préstamo de Maria con Konfío. Con los ingresos derivados de este préstamo podrá realizar pagos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives in Cuautitlan Izcalli, a neighborhood that is part of Valle de Mexico. She is a single mother that has an 8 year old child. For years ago, in order to provide a better life to her son, in addition to being an administrative worker at a company, she began a business selling food.

Maria is an ambitious woman that is very well-known in her region due to the dishes that she offers that have a unique and special flavor. During the past years, she has sacrificed many things to be able to give the best to her son, for she is the one that takes care of all the household expenses.

She is seeking a loan for MXN 10,000 to paint the space in which she finds herself and to buy more tables and chair because each day she has more clients as well as needs more ingredients to prepare the dishes that everyone enjoys. Each day, Maria has a different menu, and it is she who cooks and attends to the clients.

In order to support Maria, you can help her to improve her service, increase her sales and revenues, and at the same time allow her to save for her son to have a better future. This is the first loan Maria has taken with Konfio. With the income derived from this loan, she will make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to paint her business, buy tables and chairs and ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: María Monserrat

texts.es:
María nació en 1980 en la Ciudad de México. Está casada y es madre de un hermoso niño de 5 años. Vive en la delegación Álvaro Obregón, en la que hay muchos comercios pequeños y alta competencia. Siguiendo su pasión por el arte y las ganas de tener un negocio, comenzó un negocio vendiendo manualidades como muñecos y peluches. 
Un préstamo de MXN 10,000 le ayudará a comprar materiales en grandes cantidades para crear sus productos como telas, accesorios, hilos, estambres y agujas. Ha estado en este negocio por casi 3 años. En un futuro le gustaría poner una tienda en la que pudiera vender todos sus productos, incrementando su cartera de clientes. 
Su sueño es ser la dueña de su propia casa, en la que puede compartir momentos inolvidables con su familia. 
Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante a pesar de todos los retos que la vida le pone. Gracias a sus únicos y excelentes productos, ha logrado atraer a muchos clientes, por lo que ha tenido muy buenas ganancias en los últimos meses. María estará muy agradecida si la apoyan en este proyecto para poder cumplir todos sus sueños. Este es el primer préstamo de María con Konfío y gracias al incremento en sus ingresos podrá ser muy puntual con las fechas de pago.
texts.en:
Maria was born in 1980 in Mexico City. She is married and is a mother to a beautiful 5 year old son. She lives in the delegation Alvaro Obregon, in which there are many small businesses and high competition. Following her passion of art and the desire of having a business, she began a business selling crafts such as dolls and stuffed animals. A loan of MXN 10,000 will help her to buy materials in large quantities to create products such as fabrics, accessories, threads, yarns and needles. She has been in the business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to open a store in which she could sell all of her products and increase her portfolio of clients.

Her dream is her own house in which she could share unforgettable moments with her family. She is a hard working woman who is always fighting to get ahead despite all the challenges that life gives her. Thanks to her unique and excellent products, she has been able to attract many clients, which has given her good earnings in the last few months. Maria is very thankful if you help her in this project so that she can reach her dreams. This is her first loan with Konfio, and, thanks to the increase in her income, she will be very punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy materials in bulk such as fabrics, accessories, threads and needles.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es una joven de 20 años, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Claudia con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, él tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor.
Claudia ahora ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales como papas, gas propano, aceite y condimentos para ofrecerle a los clientes las mejores papas fritas de su pueblo.
El gran sueño de Claudia es poder contar con dos carretas y para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 20 years old and lives with her parents in the community of Sololá. With an eagerness to have some income and to help her parents with the household expenses, Claudia sells french fries and  has been doing this for five years. She has now taken the initiative of asking for a loan so she can buy her supplies such as potatoes, propane gas, oil, and condiments and offer her customers the best french fries in her village. 

Claudia's big dream is to have two carts so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, propane gas, oil and seasonings to make french fries.

loans.name: Marko

texts.en:
Marko is a hard working 33 year old farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. He is married and blessed with 2 children aged 8 and 10 years. 
Marko started farming when he was barely a teenager on his family's 5 acre piece of land. The land now has 2 dairy cows, 20 heads of poultry and 50 trees. Marko also runs a barber shop on the side. 


Marko is seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Tools are very important in any farm business because they determine the quality of work. With use, farm tools become worn out and they lose efficiency. At times farmers sharpen and modify tools to restore their value but at times, it is economical to go brand new.

The impact of this loan to Marko is improved work output. The newly farm implements will come with better design, more durability and increased efficiency. Marko's work on the farm will become easier and more productive.

loans.use: to venture into crop farming  which will improve his work output

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherry is 23 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cherry has a fishing  business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Cherry has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Cherry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: Trabajadora, soñadora y muy alegre, María nació en 1968 en Nuevo León, estado al norte de México que comparte frontera con Texas, Estados Unidos. Ahí vive actualmente con su esposo y dos hijos. A sus 47 años de edad, María tiene un negocio que ayuda a las personas a estilizar su figura, lo que las hace sentir bellas por dentro y por fuera. Es una mujer dispuesta a darle siempre lo mejor a su familia. Su mayor sueño es convertirse en una empresa reconocida a nivel internacional. Este es su segundo préstamo con Konfío y le ayudará a comprar más mercancía en grandes cantidades como fajas y prendas que reafirman la piel y crear publicidad para expandirse a otros tres estados del país. María está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas que la apoyen a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en: A hard worker, dreamer, and very cheerful, Maria was born in 1968 in Nuevo Leon, in the northern state of Mexico that shares a border with Texas, U.S.A. There she lives with her husband and two kids. In her 47 years, Maria has a business that helps people style their figure, in order to make them feel beautiful on the inside and outside. She is a woman ready to always give the best to her family. Her biggest dream is to become a businesswoman internationally recognized. This is her second loan with Konfio, and is will help her to buy more merchandise in large quantities like belts and garments that give good shape to the body and to create publicity to expand to three other states. Maria is very thankful to Kiva and lenders that help her in achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy corsets in bulk and create advertising.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 29 years old and has one child. They live in a rural community and engages herself in direct selling of Avon, Natasha, MSE and Board walk products within their community. She has been in this business for more than fives years. She aspires to continue and improve this business but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she is asking for an additional of PHP5,000.00 to buy more stocks of the said products to resell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve more of her business to sustain the necessities of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon, Natasha, MSE and Board Walk products to resell

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen earns a living by transporting passengers from one barrio to other remote areas. He engages in habal-habal(motorcycle) transport services.  He resides in Talibon, Bohol.  He is 24 year old single man. 

He has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to buy tire and motorcycle oil. With these, he would cater better services and able to improve his earnings. Glen would able to pay his obligations and start to expand his transportation services.

Glen hopes that his source of income will become successful to improve is living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tire and motorcycle oil to keep his bike running and improve his living conditions

loans.name: Ma. Zaida

texts.en:
Ma. Zaida is 50 years old and married with six children. One of her children is in school, Ma. Zaida works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Zaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, dried fish, personal product care and other groceries.

Ma. Zaida has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ma. Zaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, condiments, dried fish, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda is 37 years old and married with seven children. With six children in school, Alfreda works very hard to provide for them.

Alfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, liquor, home product care and other groceries.

Alfreda has been in this business for 17 years. 

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, liquor, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Elmelita

texts.en:
