Elmelita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elmelita is 35 years old and has five children who are in school.

Elmelita has a seaweeds business in the Philippines. Elmelita requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her seaweeds business.

Elmelita has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Elmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her seaweeds business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 43 years old and has three children. Emelita is married and has three children who are in school.

Emelita is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy seaweed seeds and other farm supplies.

Emelita has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Alma requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alma has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en: A 40-year-old mother of five children and two of them are in school, living in Kampong Cham province, Sokly is a rice farmer and a factory worker for twenty years. She could earn about 47,200KHR per day. Now she faces with a problem of lacking money to do the farm, so she decides to take a loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Independiente y muy comprometida en los negocios, Erika tiene 33 años y vive con su esposo e hijo. Desde hace dos años ella ha tenido un local de comida vendiendo barbacoa. Erika ha visto sus esfuerzos reflejados en todo lo que ha hecho hasta ahora. Quiere convertir su negocio en un establecimiento más formal y por esa razón le gustaría un préstamo de MXN 4,000 para comprar mesas y sillas para ofrecer un mejor servicio. 
Cuando tenga mayor estabilidad financiera ella realmente espera poder cumplir su sueño de ser una exitosa abogada. Lo que más desea en esta vida es poder tener su propia casa para poder brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. 
La mayor satisfacción que Erika puede tener es ver la sonrisa sincera de los clientes, quienes se sienten en confianza al ir a su negocio y la ven como una amiga. Con este préstamo ella será capaz de incrementar su ingreso mensual y poder pagar en tiempo y forma en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en:
Independent and committed to her business, Erike is 33 years old and lives with her husband and child. FOr two years, she has had a small food shop selling barbacoa. Erika has seen her efforts reflected in everything she has done so far. She would like to convert her business to a more formal establishment, and for this reason, she would like a loan of MXN 4,000 to buy tables and chairs to provide better service.

When she has more financial stability, she would like to achieve her dream of being a successful lawyer. What she most desires in life is to be able to have her own house so that she can provide the best conditions of life to her family.

The greatest satisfaction that Erika can have is to see the sincere smile of her clients, who feel confident in her business and see her as a friend. With this loan, she will be able to increase her monthly income and pay on time and in good form on her first loan with Konfio.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food shop

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: Lilian tiene 20 años y está soltera. Actualmente está estudiando Inglés en una academia cerca de su casa para poder tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Lilian también está aplicando en una universidad prestigiosa de su región para estudiar una Licenciatura en Comunicación Social. Por casi tres años ella ha tenido un negocio vendiendo cosméticos. Está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 5,000 para surtir su negocio y hacer inventario, lo que le permitirá incrementar notablemente sus ventas y ganancias mensuales. Lilian es una mujer muy comunicativa y comprensiva que tiene el deseo de trabajar desde muy pequeña, lo que la ha ayudado a que su negocio sea muy exitoso.
texts.en: Lilian is 20 years old and is single. She is studying English at an academy close to her house so that she can have the best work opportunities. Lilian is also applying to a prestigious university in her region to study for a Bachelors in Social Communication. For almost three years, she has had a business selling cosmetics. She is seeking a loan for MXN 5,000 to supply her business and have inventory. This will allow her to notably increase her sales and monthly revenues. Lilian is a woman who is very communicative and comprehensive that has had the desire to work since she was young. This has helped her business have success.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in large quantities

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 10 años y una hija de 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de fruta por mayor.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en villa dolores’ que es la zona más antigua y populosa de la ciudad, que sufre la falta de servicios básicos, como agua y luz. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varia durante el día entre -4, 8 grados centígrados.
Elena es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa trenzado, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, pollera y sombrero), y su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica al transporte de fruta, y con sus hijos que asisten a la escuela por las mañanas para ayudar en el comercio por la tarde. viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de fruta, negocio que inició cuando su esposo transportaba la fruta desde el norte de la ciudad hasta el Tambo. Actualmente ella realiza la compra por mayor a los productores y la reparte a mercados minoristas, “la fruta se comercia todo el año, ahora entramos en la temporada de cítricos...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra en un lugar muy comercial y de fácil acceso, la desventaja son los paros de transporte público que dificultan el traslado de la fruta. Su sueño es comprarse un camión donde su esposo pueda transportar la fruta. Ella desea realizar la compra de fruta de temporada por mayor como; naranjas, mandarina, pomelos, etc. para pagar los gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta de temporada por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a 42 year old woman who lives with her spouse and has two sons, ages 5 and 10, as well as a 14 year old daughter.  Her business is the sale of fruit wholesale.  She is a good mother, enterprising, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible and very hard working.  She works in Villa Dolores which is the oldest and most populated zone in the city.  It lacks basic services such as water and light.  The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day between -4 and 8 degrees centigrade.  

Elena has dark skin, dark eyes, long black braided hair, is of medium stature and her dress is traditional ( sweater, skirt and hat)  Her native language is Aymara, which she speaks at home.  She also speaks Spanish in public and for her business.  She lives with her husband who works in fruit transportation, and with her children who attend school in the morning and help with work in the afternoons.  They live in their own house, constructed of adobe with a corrugated tin roof and wood floor.  They have drinking water and electricity but do not have a sewage system.  

Her business is the sale of fruit.  She started this when her husband was transporting the fruit from the north of the city to Tambo.  Now she is able to purchase wholesale from the producers and sell to smaller markets.  "Fruit is sold all year, and now we are in the citrus season.." she said.  The advantage of her business is that she is located in a very commercial area with easy access.  The disadvantages are the public transportation strikes, which make it difficult to move the fruit.  

Her dream is to buy a truck so her husband could transport the fruit.  She hopes to purchase the seasonal fruit wholesale such as:  oranges, mandarins, grapefruit etc. in order to pay the expenses of her children's education.  This is the third sequence of loans with the institution in ten years that develops this activity.  For these reasons Elena seeks a loan for the purchase of seasonal fruit wholesale and to pay the educational costs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruit wholesale.  With the earnings she will pay the academic expenses of her three children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a  shade for his supply in the market to shelter it from sun.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming activity through application of modern farming technologies like greenhouse planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her stock to meet the high demand from customers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Contribute now for Rebecca. Recently, she was granted a loan which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanksgiving, she would like to avail another loan worth PHP 15,000. This time, she will utilize this loan to add heaps of grocery items for her sari-sari store business. 

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help sustain the family needs, basically their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

She simply prays to have more strength and more blessings for her family and of course, to expand her business as well. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to add heaps of grocery items for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Lorliny

texts.en:
Lorliny is 49 years old and married with four child. Four children are still in school, Lorliny works very hard to provide for them.

Lorliny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc.

Lorliny has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks  etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Cecilia has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks etc

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 47 years old and has seven children. Evangeline is married and has four children who are in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her farming seaweeds business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her farming seaweeds business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Alma is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more spices to sell like onions, garlic, etc. for her buy and sell spices business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell like onions, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old and married with five children. Five children are currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a General Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices,  drinks, bread etc.

Janet has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, bread etc

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annalyn is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Annalyn has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Annalyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell .

Annalyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Lorie Joy

texts.en:
Lorie Joy works hard to support her family. Lorie Joy is single and has an eload business in the Philippines.

Lorie Joy requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional load wallet and other materials to her business.

Lorie Joy has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional load wallet and other materials for her business

loans.name: Fevilyn

texts.en:
Fevilyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fevilyn is 28 years old.

Fevilyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fevilyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Fevilyn has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Fevilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a married woman, 77 years old with seven children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Lucila has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Lucila requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Lucila has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lynn is 37 years old and has one child still in school.

Lynn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lynn requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lynn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: Maricela tiene 19 años y vive en San Luis Potosí, ubicado en la región centro-norte de México. En su tiempo libre le gusta practicar danza folklórica y está aplicando en una universidad para estudiar Medicina. Desde hace 2 años inició un negocio de maquila de uniformes en su propia casa y con el paso del tiempo fue tomando más formalidad. Está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 4,000 para comprar material necesario para poder hacer uniformes y reparar su computadora para poder registrar todas las operaciones. Con este préstamo ella podrá acelerar el proceso de recibo y entrega de los productos y producir uniformes de mejor calidad para poder tener mayor estabilidad financiera. Gracias al aumento en sus ganancias mensuales, podrá realizar pagos en tiempo en su primer préstamo con Konfío y ahorrar para cubrir sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Maricela is 19 years old and lives in San Luis Potosi, located in the central north region of Mexico. In her free time, she likes to practice folklorico dance and is applying to a university to study medicine. Since she was 2 years old, she began a business selling uniforms in her own home, and as time passed, she was taking more formality. She is seeking a loan for MXN 4,000 to buy necessary material to make uniforms and to repair her computer to be able to register all of the operations. With this loan, she will be able to accelerate the receipt process and delivery of the products and produce uniforms of better quality to be better established financially. THanks to the increase in her monthly earnings, she can repay her first loan with Konfio on time and save to cover her university studies.

loans.use: to buy materials for uniforms and to fix her computer

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 37 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Rhea works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rhea has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 42 years old, married, and blessed with six children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for 10 years now. 

She will be using the loan to buy dairy feeds and for her dairy cow and hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her future hopes are to improve her dairy farming, make more income, and support her family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds for her dairy cow; she hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell to be able to support her family.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Being a responsible father, Gerald aimed to educate his children and give his family a better life. He is 36 years old and has three children attending school. Due to financial hardship, he operate his motorcycle transport so as to have an additional source of income. To continuously operate his motorcycle, he needs a loan of PHP5,000.00 to buy wheels and other motorcycle parts and accessories for the maintenance of his motorcycle. Being patient and hard working father, he believes that someday, he will further improve the business, as well as his state of living.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other motorcycle parts and accessories

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Absalon

texts.es:
Absalon tiene 49 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y 6 menores hijos, viven en una zona rural del Distrito de Santo Tomas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Absalón es la cría y comercialización de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, tiene amplia experiencia en el rubro y buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Adicionalmente tiene cultivado maíz amarillo que lo utiliza en el engorde de sus animales. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de animales pequeños para engordar y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio a sus clientes, esto le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejroar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Absalon, age 49, has a stable home alongside his partner and their six young children. They live in the rural District of Santo Tomas, where most people are in farming, ranching, or trade. This district is in the province of Cutervo, part of the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Absalon makes his living by raising and selling small animals like guinea pigs and hens . He has a lot of experience in this field and good references both personal and professional from his neighbors. He also raises yellow corn that he uses to fatten his animals. He has requested this loan to buy small animals which he will then fatten and offer at a greater price to his customers. This will help him increase his income level and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy animals to fatten and sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 44 years old and has six children who are in school.

Josephine has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like herbal oil and other products to sell in her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like herbal oil and other products to sell in her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Marissa has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Marissa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is 55 years old and married with two children. Ma. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like milk, coffee, spices, canned goods, breads, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Ma. Nida has been in this business for 25 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like milk, coffee, spices, canned goods, breads, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
Hipólito es un hombre de 38 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 4 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Hipólito para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para niños él tiene dos años de realizar esta labor, pero Hipólito cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes en la escuela de su pueblo.
Hipólito ahora necesita de un préstamo, porque necesita comprar algunos materiales como madera, cemento, clavos para remodelar su tienda de ropas y darle una mejor presentación.
El gran sueño de Hipólito es contar con un local más grande para poder exhibir mejorar sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Hipólito is a 38 year old man.  He is married and has a lovely family with four children between the ages of 4 and 12 years.  This humble family lives in a community in San Pablo Jocopilas.  Hipólito has been working in the buying and selling of children's clothing for two years to support his family.  His wife also works in the purchase and sale of groceries in the school of their town.  

Hipólito needs a loan now because he needs to purchase materials such as wood, cement and nails to remodel his clothing store and give it a nicer appearance.  His real dream is to have a larger store front to be able to exhibit his products better and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase wood, cement and nails.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Remedios has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 52 years old and has four children. Mercedita is married and has three children who are in school.

Mercedita is in the agricultural business farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her seaweeds business

loans.name: Mela

texts.es: Mela tiene una tienda de abarrotes, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace dos años, ella solicita un préstamo de $1,500 para comprar productos comestibles y surtir su tienda, generar más ventas y por supuesto obtener mayores ingresos. Así logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Mela runs a grocery store, a line of work she's had for two years. She is requesting a loan for $1500 which she will use to buy consumable goods to stock her store. With this merchandise, she can increase her sales and obviously earn more income. That will help her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: stock her store with groceries to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 42 years old and married with six children. Three children are still in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.

Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, spices, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, spices etc

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Naneth is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Naneth has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Naneth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Naneth has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años y es madre de dos hijos. Desde hace tres años decidió convertirse en una mujer emprendedora para tener su propio dinero. Maria vende todo tipo de dulces en su propia casa en Nezahualcoyotl. 
Maria siempre ha buscado la manera de salir adelante para proveerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 5,000 para surtir su negocio con chocolates, paletas, bombones, palomitas y papas fritas. Ella planea abrir una papelería o un centro de copiado en los próximos meses para tener mayores ingresos y ser económicamente estable para poder estar en paz personal y profesionalmente.  
La mejor parte de su día es ver la satisfacción de los clientes, que es su motor para poder seguir adelante. Este préstamo le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y llegar su negocio hacia un establecimiento más formal, lo que aumentará su cartera de clientes y sus ingresos mensuales. Este es su primer préstamo con Konfío y está muy comprometida a realizar pagos satisfactorios.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and a mother of two children. Three years ago she decided to become an entrepreneur to have her own money. Maria sells all kinds of sweets at home in Nezahualcoyotl.
Maria has always sought ways to move forward to provide a better quality of life for her family. She is requesting a loan of MXN 5,000 for her business with chocolates, lollipops, bonbons, popcorn and fries. She plans to open a stationery or a copy shop in the coming months to make more income and become financially stable to be in peace personally and professionally.
The best part of her day is to see  customer satisfaction, which is the engine to move forward. This loan will allow her to increase sales and get her business into a more formal setting, increasing her customer base and her monthly income. This is her first loan with Konfío, and she is very committed to make satisfactory payments.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, lollipops, bonbons, popcorn, and fries

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 33-year-old single woman, living with her parents and four siblings. She is the main income provider in her family and works hard to supplement the family’s income.

She decided to become a farmer in 2008. Today, she is applying for her second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. The loan will enable Miriam to buy agricultural tools and an electric generator which will increase her business productivity significantly and provide a higher return on her profits.

loans.use: to buy agricultural tools and an electric generator

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, flour, bread, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread,sugar and other items. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, bread,sugar and other items

loans.name: Jean Merry

texts.en:
Jean Merry is 21 years old and single.

Jean Merry is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Jean Merry requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business like plastic, etc..

Jean Merry has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jean Merry would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her seaweeds business like plastics, etc.

loans.name: Lorenor

texts.en:
Lorenor is 30 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a snack food vending business in the Philippines. Lorenor requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lorenor has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorenor would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 56 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 14 y 29 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la Aldea Chocola.
Pedro con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa trabaja como guardián de una empresa desde hace ocho años.
Pedro ahora se encuentra muy orgulloso de uno de sus hijos, pues está a punto de graduarse, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar la colegiatura y pagar el vestuario de la graduación, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder ayudar a su hijo.
El gran sueño de Pedro es poder dejarles a sus hijos una buena herencia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 56-year-old man. He is married, and he has a beautiful family of four children, who are between the ages of 14 and 29. This humble family lives in a community in the village of Chocola. Eager to obtain an income and to help his spouse with household expenses, Pedro has been working as a security guard for a company for the past eight years.

Currently, Pedro is very proud of one of his children, who is about to graduate. However, one of the difficulties that he is facing is that he does not have enough money to pay his tuition and to buy his graduation gown. It is for this reason that Pedro made a decision to request a loan in order to help his son. Pedro's greatest dream is to be able to leave his children a good inheritance.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition and to buy him a graduation gown.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is a rural villager living in Mondulkiri province; she is aged 26 years old and a mother of four children, only one of whom is in school. 

Grocery seller and rice farmer have been her businesses for seven years. Due to lack of funds, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income to support her family’s living through this loan.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three children.

For eight years, she has operated a retail business selling soda, biscuits, yogurt, and cakes. Her business is in an excellent location by a bus station, and her primary customers are very diverse.

She describes her biggest business challenge as the high prices of goods. This  KES 30,000 loan will help Beatrice increase her inventory of juices, biscuits, yogurt, and other items.

She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: increase her inventory of juices, biscuits, yogurt and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farm inputs to increase milk production allowing her to expand her business

loans.name: Dúo Girasoles De Patzun Group

texts.es: Dúo Girasoles de Patzun, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Agustina de 43 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica, y como actividad secundaria se dedica al cultivo, esta muy agradecida con Fape y Kiva por la ayuda en su negocio, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en ropa tipica para la venta, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes, espera que le puedan seguir ayudando en su negocio para que salga adelante.
texts.en: The group Dúo Girasoles de Patzun consists of Agustina who is 43 years of age. She makes a living selling traditional clothing and works in farming as a secondary occupation. She is very grateful to FAPE and Kiva for the help with her business.  On this occasion, she is requesting this loan to buy more traditional clothing to sell now that she has many orders from her customers. She hopes that they can continue helping her in her business so that she can succeed.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to increase her inventory of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like fattening pigs.

Ailyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: An optimistic and cheerful woman, Beatriz is 25 years old and lives with her boyfriend as an unmarried couple. She is originally from Acapulco, Guerrero, one of the most visited places in Mexico for vacation.  Beatriz owns a computer accessories business. She is doing everything possible to make a saving in order to start a family in a near future. Her biggest dream is to own a home where she can share happy moments with her family and leave them a legacy. For that reason she plans to turn her business into a formal setting in order to expand to other regions. In her town she has a lot of competitors and she tries her best to offer a better quality of products for attracting more clients. She would like a loan of MXN 12,000 to stock with new products in order to expand her catalogue and customers’ base which will allow her to increase earnings, with which will be able to be in time with repayment dates on her second loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to stock her computer accessories business with new products

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria nació en 1983 en Saltillo, Coahuila, al noreste de México. Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo es Ingeniero en Sistemas. Maria tiene una Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas. El mayor sueño de los dos es tener estabilidad financiera para poder darles la mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Por esa razón hace dos años iniciaron un negocio dando asesoría en administración de redes y sistemas de seguridad para compañías. Es una mujer independiente que ha luchado con el paso de los años para crecer y sobresalir profesionalmente, pero sobretodo para estar mejor preparada para la vida y planea iniciar una Maestría en un futuro. Está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 7,000 para comprar el software necesario y cubrir los gastos operativos de su negocio. Maria está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas por confiar en ella. Con este préstamo ella será capaz de mejorar su servicio y ser muy puntual en las fechas de pago en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Maria was born in 1983 in Saltillo, Coahuila, northeast of Mexico. She lives with her husband and two small children. Her husband is a Systems Engineer. Maria holds a Bachelor of Business Administration. The biggest dream of the two is to have financial stability in order to give them the best quality of life to their children. For that reason two years ago they started a business providing advice on network management and security systems for companies. She is an independent woman who has struggled over the years to grow and excel professionally, but above all to be better prepared for life and plans to start a Masters in the future. She is requesting a loan of MXN 7,000 to purchase the necessary software and cover the operating expenses of her business. Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders who trust her. With this loan she will be able to improve their service and be very punctual on payment dates on their first Konfío loan.

loans.use: to buy necessary software and cover operating expenses

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is a single mother of 44 years. She has one son of 10 years old. She is an entrepreneurial, determined, responsible, hardworking and kind person. In order to provide the best to her child, in addition to her administrative job in a company, she owns a laundry, which is the greater source of her profits. Esperanza's biggest dream is to see her child developed personally and professionally. On weekend, sometimes Esperanza has to take her son to work (as shown in the picture). She is asking for a loan of MXN 10,000 to purchase a washing machine which will speed the production. With a new washing machine Esperanza will be able to offer a better service and earn maximum profit and pay for a nanny. This is Esperanza’s first loan with Konfío and is very grateful to Kiva and those who support her to continue growing her business. In the future, she would like to save money to own a home, where she can share unforgettable moments with her son.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Tajibal Group

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es buena madre, generosa, amable, abnegada, buena mujer, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ que es uno de los sectores más poblados de la ciudad, Allí radican pobladores nacidos en esta ciudad y residentes migrantes de otras ciudades. Ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad, es un área que carece de servicios básicos. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Lourdes es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (la primera de la izquierda viste polera blanca y calza roja). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de taxi, y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de hoja de coca, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, confección de tejidos, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades. Su negocio es la preparación y venta de pollo a la broaster (pollo frito), que es un modo de cocinar el pollo muy sabroso y casero, Para su elaboración hace falta una gran cantidad de aceite, “la receta es sencilla, se debe freír en aceite caliente hasta que se dore y quede bien crocante, y Se puede acompañar con papas fritas, arroz o ensalada. …” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de venta de pollo frito. Ella desea comprar insumos de cocina como; aceite, pollo, arroz, y otros para abastecer su negocio. Esta es su 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio y con los beneficios alimentar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a 27-year old woman. She lives with her husband and has three children, who are 9-, 7- and 4-years old respectively. Her business is selling fried chicken. Lourdes is a good mother. She is generous, friendly, selfless, a good woman, responsible and very hard-working.

Lourdes runs her business in the "Plan 3000" area, which is one of the city's most populated sectors. People native to the city and well as immigrants from other cities settle down there. The area is located outside of the city and lacks many basic services. The climate there is warm and subtropical with a temperature that ranges during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Lourdes has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair that she wears tied back. She is short and thin. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish when out and about and to run her business. (In the above photo, she is first from the left and wearing a white t-shirt and red pants).

Lourdes shares her life with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, and their children. The two older children go to school, and the youngest is not yet school-aged. They live in their own home, which is made of brick and cement, has a corrugated iron roof and has brick floors. The house has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.

A desire to improve her business brought Lourdes to lead a communal bank. The members' various businesses include: selling cell phone covers, selling coca leaves, selling quinoa juice, perfume sales, making cloth, selling beverages, skirt sales, selling ice cream and making empanadas. They are requesting a loan together to expand their businesses.

Lourdes's business is preparing and selling broaster chicken (fried chicken). It is a way of cooking chicken that is home-cooked and delicious. To make it, you need a lot of cooking oil. "The recipe is simple. Fry it in hot oil until golden and very crispy. You can always have it with french fries, rice or salad..." Lourdes says. The advantage her business has is that she has a regular customers. The disadvantage is the competition. Lourdes's dream is to open a restaurant that serves fried chicken.

Lourdes wants to purchase kitchen supplies, such as cooking oil, chicken, rice and other items she needs to stock up her business. This is her 2nd lending cycle with the institution in the four years she has been in business.

This is the reason Lourdes is requesting a loan: so she can buy kitchen supplies to stock up her business and with the profits, feed her children.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen supplies to stock up her business, and with the profits, feed her children.

loans.name: Melvis

texts.es: Residente en un barrio del sur occidente de Barranquilla, Melvis es una carismática mujer que por tradición familiar está dedicada al comercio; en su familia siempre han sido comerciantes y gracias a las innumerables opciones de catálogos especializados que ofertan productos y artículos de uso personal de buena calidad a precios asequibles, Melvis logró incorporarse como consultora con una de esta empresas y su labor consiste en promover el catalogo y  lograr la meta de ventas apta para la solicitud de productos, los cuales cancela de contado, sin embargo ella les ofrece a sus clientes facilidad de pago.  Se dedica a esta actividad de lunes a sábado a partir de las 9 a.m. a 7 p.m. en la que realiza visitas a sus vecinos y propicia las ventas.  .  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en perfumes, ropa, y artículos de tocador.  Esta inversión permitirá incrementar el stock de productos en esta temporada en la que esta próxima la celebración del día de las madres.  Su sueño de prosperidad es poder a largo plazo tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Resident of a neighborhood in the southwest of Barranquilla, Melvis is a charismatic woman who took up the family tradition of sales. Her family has always been salespeople.  Thanks to the innumerable options for specialized catalogs that sell personal items and other products of good quality and at accessible prices, Melvis has managed to become a consultant for one of these businesses. Her work consists of promoting the catalog and meeting her sales quota appropriate to her volume. Her orders are paid in cash, but she nevertheless offers her customers easy payment.

She works from Monday to Saturday, 9:00am to 7:00pm, during which she visits neighbors and solicits sales. She is currently applying for this Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in buying perfumes, clothing, and vanity items. This investment will allow her to increase her product stock during this season, which is close to Mother's Day. Her dream of prosperity is to eventually have her own store.

loans.use: invest in perfumes, clothing, and vanity items

loans.name: Segundo Jose

texts.es:
Segundo José tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo José se dedica a brindar los servicios de albañilería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 11 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para la compra y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas de construcción, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; el espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo José is 51 years old, is married, has two children and lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Segundo José makes a living by providing bricklaying services. He has his own tools and has more than 11 years of experience in the business, which is located in his own home. He is requesting a loan to purchase and maintain his construction equipment and tools. This investment will be used to keep his equipment and tools in the best conditions, with great impact on his business. He hopes to improve the productivity of his services in order to meet the diverse needs of his customers in the area, which will increase his level of income and allow him to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase and maintain construction equipment and tools.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila City, Philippines. She is 34 years old and married to Richard, who works as a driver in their community. She has managed a buy-and-sell business for three years now, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenses.

What Rebecca basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell the items piecemeal with a little profit. She usually sells foods such as biscuits, nuts and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to the low prices and the many options they are offered. Rebecca's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Rebecca is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to add capital for purchasing more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to prosper through her business, for she desires to help her husband in his ministry. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add capital for buying more products for her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single man from Dier al-Balah City. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works in the public sector. Ahmad would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the necessities.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will help him to provide hot water for the family's house without using electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm tools to get a batter harvest for client and family needs.

loans.name: Dúo Gloria A Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Gloria a Dios, esta conformado por la señora Lesli de 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años,su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para seguir con la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.Espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Dúo Gloria a Dios [Glory to God Duo] is formed by Lesli, who is 25 years old and makes a living by making and selling traditional weavings. She has done this work for several years and has her own business in her home. 

In this opportunity, she is requesting this loan to purchase raw material in order to continue with the production of traditional weavings and to satisfy her customers. She hopes that you are able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to make and sell traditionall weavings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, lumber, doors, and security bars for her home.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen, 44 years old, is married and blessed with one child. She has been in the farming business for 9 years. Hellen will use the loan from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her child. Hellen's future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to get more farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past five years, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. Rita has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cristian Alonso

texts.es: Cristhian tiene 27 años, vive con sus papas y se dedica a la agricultura, El con el crédito va a comprar insumos como abonos y otros productos para mejorar sus plantaciones de maíz y frijol, además de alguna semilla para sembrar algunos cortes nuevos, con una parte del credito pretende comprar una vaca de leche mas para aumentar su pruduccion y asi poder ofrecer mayor cantidad para la venta a sus vecinos de la comunidad y tambien para el consumo familiar. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria ya que toda su vida se ha dedicado a este oficio que fue aprendido de su padre, entre sus metas esta poder sacar el máximo provecho a la finca de él y su padre y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos y lograr tener un mejor nivel de vida él y su familia, Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Cristhian is 27 years old. He lives with his parents and is a farmer. With this loan, he will buy supplies such as fertilizers to improve his bean and corn crops as well as some seed to plant new cuttings. With part of the loan, he hopes to buy an additional milk cow to expand his production; this would allow him to offer greater quantity both for sale to his nearby neighbors as well as his for own family's consumption.

He has all the experience necessary since he's been working at this job his entire life, work he learned from his father. Among his goals are to get the maximum harvest from his and his father's farm, thus increasing his income and achieving a higher quality of life for him and his family.

This is his second loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR provided him the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: make the most of this family farm with beans, corn, and a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his farming production through application of modern farming technology

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools and inputs to get better produce for sale and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.en: Isaias is 59 years old and chose to be single. He lives in a rural community and earns a living through farming. He also runs a small retail store to have an additional source of income. Isaias aims to improve his retail store and increase his income in order to sustain his necessities and save some for future emergencies. Having inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more soft drinks, junk food, candies, beverages, seasonings, breads, canned goods and school supplies to resell. He believes that this financial assistance will help him to further improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, junk food, candies, beverages, seasonings, breads, canned goods and school supplies to resell

loans.name: Cesar Fidencio

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de San Miguel, ubicado en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, brinda este servicio desde hace 10 años y con clientes fijos que dan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas para su negocio, con esto el espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 32, is in a common-law marriage and cares for two children. He lives in his own home in the rural area of San Miguel, located in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. The people in this area are primarily in farming, ranching, and trade.

His primary work is hiring himself as a farm laborer for day work. He's been providing this service for ten years and he has steady customers who give him good personal and professional references. He is requesting this loan to buy new tools for his business. With these, he can provide his clients with better service, which will help him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy new tools for his job

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and has four children. Nida is married and has three children who are in school.

Nida is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her seaweeds business.

Nida has been in this business for 35 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her seaweeds business

loans.name: Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 58 años de edad, soltera, tiene 9 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, y su negocio es la artesanía en cuero.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, paciente, organizada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por la colonización de migrantes; tribus ayoreas nativas y mineros relocalizados de occidente se apropiaron del lugar e iniciaron la manufactura y el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada, viste polera blanca). Su vida la realiza en compañía de su hijo menor que es independiente y trabaja. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como;  venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, llantería, cambio de aceite, panadería, carnicería y venta de juguetes, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la artesanía en cuero; ella ofrece su visión y creatividad mediante el diseño y confección de diversos productos artesanales, como; bolsos, billeteras, monederos, tarjeteros, riñoneras, pendientes, pulseras y otros. Actividad que realiza con sus propias manos y algunas herramientas de trabajo, para transformar el cuero, dándole; identidad, forma, tamaño y color, “Todas las piezas de cuero son creadas artesanalmente por eso son, únicas y originales, no hay dos iguales, Mi trabajo parte de una vocación personal por la creación de elementos ornamentales basándome en el respeto por un oficio manual de larga tradición...” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materia prima por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para la venta de prendas de cuero, ella desea realizar la compra de materiales de confección como cuero y otros, para la producción y venta por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de cuero por mayor para la confección de artículos de cuero para abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 58-year-old woman, single, with nine independent adult children.  Her business is in artisan leather crafts.

She is enterprising, independent, patient, organized, responsible, and very hard working.  She carries out her business in the “Plan 3000” Zone, which is characterized by colonization by migrants; native Ayoreo tribes and miners who relocated from the west took ownership of the place and started up manufacturing and commerce in all areas.  It has a warm, tropical, very humid climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21° and 35° centigrade.

Carmen has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied back, short stature, and a strong build.  Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture, and due to the business she performs.  (She is shown seated, wearing a white t-shirt.)  

She lives her life in the company of her youngest son, who is independent and working.  They live in their own house, built of brick and cement, with a roof of corrugated iron and a brick floor, and which has electric energy, well water extracted by pump, and a sewage system.  Her desires to succeed led her to form a bank of people with businesses such as food sales, secondhand clothing sales, a tire shop, oil change, a bakery, a butcher’s shop, and toy sales, so that they could request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is leather artisan crafts.  She offers her vision and creativity through the design and production of diverse artisan products, such as purses, wallets, coin purses, credit card holders, belt pouches, earrings, bracelets, and more.  She carries out this activity with her own hands and some work tools in order to transform the leather, giving it identity, form, shape, and color.  “All leather works are created by hand, and therefore they are unique and original.  There are no two alike.  My work comes from a personal vocation for the creation of ornamental items, founding myself on the respect for a hand craft with a long tradition,” she comments.  

The advantage of her business is that she has constant customers.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase raw material at wholesale.  Her dream is to open a store to sell leather items.  She wants to purchase production materials such as leather and other things, for production and wholesale sales.  This is her second loan cycle with the lending institution in the 25 years that she has been carrying out this business.

It is for these reasons that Carmen is requesting a loan to buy leather at wholesale for the production of leather items, in order to open a store.

loans.use: to buy leather at wholesale for the production of artisan leather items, in order to open a store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm tools

loans.name: Angelica Judith

texts.es: Angelica tiene 35 años. Está casada y es madre de dos niños. Angelica nació en Nuevo León, México. Actualmente tiene un salario fijo como secretaria. Con el fin de darle lo mejor a su hijo, hace dos años inició un negocio vendiendo cosméticos de catálogos. Un préstamo de MXN 8,000 le ayudará a comprar cosméticos en grandes cantidades como labiales, sombras de ojos, base de maquillaje, máscara de pestañas y otros para cubrir los pedidos pendientes. Lo más importante para Angelica es la satisfacción de los clientes, ya que tiene mucha competencia en su ciudad. Su sonrisa es lo que le permite encontrar más clientes todos los días. Es una mujer muy entusiasta que nunca se da por vencida ante las dificultades que pueda enfrentar en su camino. Es una mujer que la luchado mucho por conseguir su sueño: ver a sus hijos desarrollarse profesional y personalmente. En un futuro le gustaría tener otro negocio de postres para generar estabilidad económica. Con este préstamo será capaz de incrementar sus ganancias. Angelica será muy responsable en los pagos de su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en: Angelica is 35 years old. She is married and is a mother of two children. Angelica was born in Nuevo Leon, Mexico. She has a fixed salary as a secretary. With the objective of providing the best to her son, two years ago she began a business selling cosmetics from a catalog. A loan of MXN 8,000 will help her to buy cosmetics in large quantities like lipstick, eye shadows, foundation, mascara and other things to cover outstanding orders. Most importantly for Angelica is customer satisfaction because she has a lot of competition in her town. Her smile is what attracts more customers every day. She is a very enthusiastic woman who never gives up before the difficulties that may face her. She is a woman who has fought hard to achieve her dream: to see her children grow professionally and personally. In the future she would like to have another dessert business to generate economic stability. This loan will be able to increase their profits. Angelica will be very responsible in paying her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in large quantities like lipstick, eye shadows, foundation, mascara and other things

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married and she has 3 children whose ages range from 4 to 15 years. She describes herself to be competent. For the past year, Mercy has operated a retail business where she sells stationery and offers printing and photocopy services. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be locals. Mercy will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of stationery. She hopes to have a stable business in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her brother's eye surgery.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, tortas y empanadas, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para equipamiento y mantenimiento de infraestructura de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes y asi poder ser más productiva y eficiente en su negocio, con esto ella espera poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rocio is 46 years old, is single, and lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural area where life is quiet and the inhabitants make a living in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living by making pastries, cakes and pies, and has more than 10 years of experience in the business, which is located in her own home. She is requesting this loan in order to equip and maintain the infrastructure of her business. She will use this investment to offer better products to her customers, and therefore be more productive and efficient in her business. With this, she hopes to be able to satisfy the diverse preferences and needs of the customers in her area, which will generate higher profits that will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to equip and maintain the infrastructure of her business.

loans.name: Rina Gladys

texts.es: Rina tiene 44 años de edad habita en casa propia con su grupo familiar comprendido por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, también se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa la cual es hecha por ella misma. Rina desea ampliar la variedad de productos solicitados por la clientela y también quiere comprar telas para hacer faldas, blusas y manteles para incrementar las ventas en los cantones que visita, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: sodas, jugos, agua, arroz, frijoles y telas para poder aumentar las ventas y así poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Rina, age 44, lives in her own home with her family, comprised of her husband and their two children, ages 19 and 13 years. She has a small store where she sells necessary products. She also does traveling sales of clothing that she makes herself.  Rina wants to expand the variety of products that are requested by her customers and she also wants to buy fabrics to make skirts, blouses, and tablecloths in order to expand her sales in the neighborhoods she visits. The loan that she is requesting from FUSAI will be invested in soda, juices, water, rice, beans, and fabrics to expand her sales and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: supply her retail and clothing sales businesses

loans.name: Dúo Dios Victorioso Group

texts.es: Dúo Dios Victorioso, este dúo esta conformado por la señora Vilma Aracely de 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de refacciones, se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, ella vende en el mercado Central de su localidad, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en productos comestibles para la elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
The group “Dúo Dios Victorioso” includes Sra. Vilma Aracely. She is 25 years and has been in the business of preparing and selling snacks for several years. Vilma sells her products at the central market of her town.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy food products for making her snacks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack business.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es: Magnolia de 21 años, reside en el municipio de Arjona en el departamento de Bolívar,  donde está ubicado su negocio de reciclaje, actividad que anteriormente había desempeñado tras haber laborado por muchos años en una chatarrería en donde tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a fondo el manejo de este negocio y emprender su propia microempresa.  Su labor consiste en clasificar los tipos de material para luego ser comercializados semanalmente a empresas de transformación en Cartagena.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de aluminio, cobre y demás materiales de reciclaje.  Con tres años de experiencia ha logrado mantenerse en el campo y a futuro desea ampliar el negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder comprar su vivienda.
texts.en: Magnolia, age 21, lives in the town of Arjona in the department of Bolívar, where she runs her recycling business. She used to work in a scrapyard, where she spent many years learning the trade to its core before she was finally able to launch her own small business.  Her work consists of sorting different types of material which are later sold weekly to the transforming businesses in Cartagena. She is requesting this Kiva loan, her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the purchase of aluminum, copper, and other recyclable materials. With three years of experience, she has managed to sustain herself in this field, and in the future she hopes to expand her business to improve her quality of life and earn a living.

loans.use: buy aluminum, copper, and other recyclables

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 45 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de frazadas y edredones.
Ella es emprendedora, activa, constante, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la ‘Av. 14 de Septiembre’ caracterizada por su feria considerada las más grande del país, donde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor agrícola. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja  estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que terminó la escuela y trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de frazadas y edredones. Ella es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas del lugar, sus ventas son constantes porque el frio dura todo el año, “vendemos todo tipo de frazadas como de lana, angora y ahora están de moda las frazadas coreanas que vienen con diseños…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para mejorar su variedad y aumentar el stock. Su sueño es abrir una tienda bajo techo para la venta de frazadas, ella desea mejorar su oferta mediante la compra de frazadas y edredones por mayor para ofertar en la temporada de invierno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para la compra de frazadas por mayor para abrir una tienda bajo techo y vender en la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 45, is single and has an 18-year-old son. She is enterprising, active, consistent, optimistic, patient, responsible, and very hard-working. She runs her business in the '14 de Septiembre' Avenue, which is known for its fair, one of the biggest in the country, where you can find anything from a pin to a farming tractor. The region has a cold, dry climate with daily temperatures ranging from 0-12 degrees C (32-53 F).

Carmen has brown skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she usually wears braided. She is short and of medium build, and wears traditional attire. Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with family, and she speaks Spanish for her business and with the public in general.

She shares her life with her son, who finished school and is now working. They live in their own home built of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof and a wooden floor. They have drinking water, electricity, domestic gas, and waste water services.

Her business is selling blankets and quilts. She is one of the most sought after vendors in the area, and she has steady sales due to the consistent cold throughout the year. "We sell all kinds of blankets, including wool and angora. And now, Korean blankets that come with designs are currently in style." she comments. The advantage of her business is that she can rely on steady sales. The disadvantage is that she lacks the investment capital she needs to improve her variety and increase her stock. Her dream is to open a roofed store where she can sell her blankets. She wants to improve her supply through the purchase of blankets and quilts at wholesale so she can sell them through winter.

This is her first loan sequence with the institution and she's been running her business independently for three years.

For all these reasons, Carmen is requesting this loan, which she will use to buy blankets at wholesale so that she can open a roofed store and sell during the winter.

loans.use: expand her business selling blankets to a new location more suitable for winter

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old and has five children. Susana is married and has one child in school.

Susana is in the agricultural business farming seaweed in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her seaweeds production business.

Susana has been in this business for 24 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her seaweeds production business

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
Bardhok, who at a young age lost 90% of his vision, his two children of 14 and 12 years of age, his wife and his elderly parents are living in the shack seen in the photograph, built with wooden planks and covered with metal sheet. Indeed, they are very poor. “Depending on the weather, it is extremely cold or extremely hot. In both cases, it is very difficult living in it,” said Bardhok to the loan officer.
