Maisha is a 24-year-old entrepreneur and volunteer as a cama member, living with her mother and two siblings in the Iringa district. Maisha is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to launch a venture in second-hand clothes and shoes (mitumba) in her local area. 

She will use the loan to buy clothes and shoes in bulk which she can then sell on for profit. Maisha plans to use the profit she earns to improve her own education. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Maisha's volunteering to encourage students to join cama after completing their secondary education, which are so valuable for Camfed.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
LOAN USE: To rent a room and open her own grocery store
Neema is a 20-year-old entrepreneur and volunteer Cama member as Camfed alumnae, living with her mother and cousin in the Gairo district. She involves them in various income-generating activities, as an alternative to being lazy. Neema is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to rent a room, and open her own grocery store. She plans to use the profits earned to support her relative’s daily needs as well as their own entrepreneurial projects. Ultimately, she intends to return to school and complete her final school exams. The interest on Neema’s “social-interest” of volunteering to recruit other Camfed- supported students to join Cama, which is so valuable for Camfed’s younger women.

loans.use: to rent a room and open her own grocery store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
LOAN USE: To buy more products to expand her restaurant.
Fatuma is a 23-year-old restaurant owner and volunteer in cama network, living with her parents and child in the Gairo district. She sells food from her restaurant in order to help her support her dependants. She is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy more products for her restaurant with which to expand and improve her business. Fatuma plans to use the profits earned to better support her family’s basic needs and raise their standard of living, while also giving her the chance to be an excellent business dealer.

loans.use: to buy more products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a food market

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina is a 20-year-old entrepreneur and volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who lives with her parents and siblings in the Gairo district. Through her volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, Helina teaches life-skills to her students in the nearby secondary school. Her lessons focus on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. She is now requesting a Kiva loan to launch her own mobile money transfer business. Helina plans to use the profits earned to support her family’s domestic needs and then to open another business. The interest on Helina’s “social-interest” loan will be repaid through her weekly two and a half hours of volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger students.

loans.use: to launch her own mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new cloth prints to attract more customers

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a 25-year-old entrepreneur and volunteer Camfed alumnae member (cama), living with her family in the Kilosa district. As she currently braiding hair to her nearby villagers, she is now requesting a Kiva loan in order to launch a venture in a hairdressing salon. 

She will use the loan to buy the equipment and rent the space necessary to open her own salon. Mwanahamisi plans to use the profit she earns to pay for her siblings' schooling fees, buy a plot of land and pursue success as an entrepreneur. The interest on her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Mwanahamisi's volunteering, which are so valuable for Camfed’s younger women.

loans.use: to buy the equipment and rent the space necessary to open her own salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a business of selling fried fish near her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: start a clothing business

loans.name: Makombo

texts.en: Makombo is 33 years old, married and lives with her husband in Pangani district. She volunteers as a Camfed alumnae member to recruit new members  supported by Camfed to join the Cama network. Makombo requests a Kiva loan to start a business selling fried fish near her home. The profit will be used to increase her business and pay the household expenses of her family.

loans.use: to start a business selling fried fish near her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell from her stall

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.es:
Eriberto tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hija en casa propia en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña, un distrito dedicado al comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 2 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera el espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eriberto is 28, and lives with his partner and daughter in their own home in a large community in the urban area of Zaña, a district where people engage in commerce and livestock-raising. It is located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast.

He raises and sells pigs, and has been engaged in this business for more than two years. His business is located at his home. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a greater quantity of animals and feed for raising them. In this way he hopes to expand his business, earn more income, and be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of animals and feed for raising them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her successful tailoring business to include batik and African attire.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing (pagnes wax - colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments (fresh okra)

loans.name: Wendlasongda Group

texts.fr: Salamata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 continuent d'aller à l'école. Cette femme battante gère sa boutique depuis 2 ans. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour approvisionner sa boutique. Elle va acheter du savon, des biscuits, de l'omo,... pour vendre. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice avec lequel, elle aidera à faire les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en: Salamata, the group's representative, is married and the mother of 6 children, 2 of whom are still at school. This determined woman has been running her shop for 2 years. She needs this loan in order to restock on merchandise. She is going to buy items like soap, biscuits, and Omo washing powder for resale. After she has sold her stock, she will have a profit which will help her to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy milk, soap, sugar, biscuits sweets etc. for resale.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en:
Layal is an engaged, 25-year-old lady who opened a beauty care salon three years ago to cover her needs and expenses.

She is a hardworking and ambitious lady who has eight years of experience in this field. She learned beauty care from an institute. She has a good reputation among her customers and she is always trying to develop her business. 

Today she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy updated machines and tools that will facilitate her work and help her to provide her customers with better service. She also wants to help her sister in opening her own business.
 
Layal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy updated machines and tools for her beauty care salon, and to help her sister in opening her own business

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en:
Mahammadali is a 54-year-old man on a pension, and he is married with four children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family on the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He receives a pension from the government each month, but this is too low to cover the family's needs.

Mahammadali breeds cattle, and he sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He has more than 24  years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle. 

Mahammadali usually buys young cattle, and then raises and fattens them for 5 - 6 months before reselling them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar. He also sells milk and yoghurt to his neighbors. Milk and meat-selling brings an income of 280 AZN per month. 

Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and so are consumed in everyday life. 

There is only one income in his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Therefore Mahammadali has applied for 1,200 AZN to purchase one cow and one milk cow. 

This will be Mahammadali's 6th loan from Aqroinvest and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and one milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy vegetables (tomatoes)

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena works hard to support her family. Gena is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Gena has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gena would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky works hard to support her family. Vicky is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of banana to sell.

Vicky has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Vicky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Djenebablen's Group

texts.fr: Djenebablen qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à l'extreme gauche  portant un voile au coude de couleur blanche, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Safe Koro au sud de Bamako au Mali. Djenebablen, âgée de 52 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 13 à 38 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Djenebablen à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 38 ans. Djenebablen cultive l'arachide et fait du maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles. Djenebablen entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Djenebablen effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 38 ans que Djenebablen cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Djenebablen planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Djenebablen espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Djenebablen, who is standing on the left in the picture and wearing a white shawl, is a member of a group of 7 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Safe Koro, in the south of Bamako in Mali. Djenebablen is 52 years old and the mother of 5 children aged between 13 and 38, 2 of whom still attend school. Djenebablen has been a farmer for 38 years and was motivated to take up agriculture because farming is a long held family tradition (it is the primary source of revenue and enables a household's food self-sufficiency) and she is married to a farmer.

Djenebablen grows groundnuts and has a market garden on her plot of land but, as a farmer,  has to face problems like a lack of rain and a lack of agricultural equipment. Djenebablen is starting her second year with myAgro and has re-enrolled because of the prospect of being able to increase her yield thanks to the services provided by myAgro, and because of the positive image that myAgro has in the neighbouring villages. This year, Djenebablen will be making payments towards a packet of myAgro fertiliser to grow groundnuts so that she can increase the yield on her 0.25 hectare plot of land. Djenebablen has been growing groundnuts for 38 years because of their nutritional value, as groundnuts are directly consumable by the family and are an ingredient in a basic sauce used for food preparation. The increase of her production and revenue will allow Djenebablen to keep doing business. Finally, Djenebablen hopes to be able to cover her children's education expenses and to build a home for the family.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertiliser with which to grow groundnuts and to benefit from the training and techniques provided by myAgro.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy a gallon of gasoline, fishing net and other fishing materials.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a gallon of gasoline, fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 33 years old and married, and she has 2 kids. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her  family on the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years and currently has a cow and 10 sheep, as well as 1 hectare of land where she grows beans.

Kamala has approached Aqroinvest CU  for a loan of 1,500 AZN  to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. This will allow her to increase her head count of livestock and develop her business. 

This is Kamala's 3rd loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Alprecia

texts.en:
Alprecia is 35 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school, Alprecia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like rice, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

Alprecia has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Alprecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, coffee, milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell for her general store business.

Jocelyn earns more income from buy and sell rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Sabren

texts.en:
Sabren works hard to help her husband to cover the household expenses, and she wants to provide a good education for her two kids. This was the reason she decided to open her own business.

Sabren rented a small shop beside her home and started a business in home supplies. She gets a good income from this work. 

Because of the high cost of living, she has decided to expand her business. Therefore she has applied for a loan to help her to buy new products to sell, and to develop her store to increase her profit and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To buy new products to sell, and to develop her store to increase her profit and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Yacouba's Group

texts.fr: Yacouba qui se trouve à l’extreme gauche sur la photo, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Laban au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Yacouba, âgé de 65 ans, est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 12 à 38 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Yacouba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 53 ans. Il explique que "l'agriculture est notre premier valeur."  Yacouba cultive le mais, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Il explique que la "la vieillesse se prepare aucour de la jeunesse." Yacouba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Yacouba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle d’ 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 53 ans que Yacouba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Yacouba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Yacouba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Yacouba, who is standing on the left in the picture, is a member of a group of 4 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Laban, in the south-east of Bamako in Mali. Yacouba is 65 years old and the father of 8 children aged between 12 and 38, one of whom still attends school. Yacouba has been a farmer for 53 years and was motivated to take up agriculture because farming is a long held family tradition (it is the primary source of revenue and enables a household's food self-sufficiency). Yacouba says that "farming is our primary value." Yacouba grows corn and rice on his plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems like a lack of rain, a lack of agricultural equipment and a lack of good quality fertiliser. He says that old age is prepared for during one's youth.

Yacouba is starting his first year with myAgro and has enrolled because of the payment system and the good quality seeds, as well as the training and agricultural techniques provided by myAgro. This year, Yacouba will be making payments towards a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) maize seeds and fertiliser so that he can increase the yield on his 1 hectare plot of land. Yacouba has been growing maize for 53 years because of its nutritional and commercial value, as maize is one of the food products he sells at the market. Once his output and income have increased, Yacouba plans to increase the amount of land he cultivates and to start raising livestock. Finally, Yacouba also hopes to be able to cover his child's education expenses and to build a home for the family.

loans.use: to buy a package of OPV maize seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.fr: Kadia qui se trouve à l’extreme gauche est assise et tend la pochette myAgro , est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Laban au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Kadia, âgée de 50  ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 15 à 20 ans, et dont aucun d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Kadia à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Kadia cultive l’arachide, le riz et pratique le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Kadia entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Kadia effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d’arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Kadia cultive l’arachide pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu'elle vend sur le marché. Kadia planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d’acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Kadia espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Kadia is sitting on the far left in the photo, holding her myAgro bag.  She is a member of a group of eight farmers who all work with the field partner myAgro.  The women all live and work in the village of Laban, south-east of Bamako, in Mali. 

Kadia is 50 years old and has three children between the ages of fifteen and twenty years old.  None of her children currently attends school.  Kadia has been working in agriculture for forty years and it is the main source of income and food for her family.  She grows peanuts, rice and vegetables on her land and has to cope with a lack of rain, agricultural supplies and good quality fertilizer.

This will be Kadia's first year working with myAgro.  She plans to buy seed and fertilizer to increase her crop of peanuts.  She has been growing peanuts for thirty years because they are a valuable food source and also for their market value.  Kadia will use her earnings to buy further agricultural supplies, pay for schooling for her children and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi un homme de 34ans est infirmier de profession. Il revend aussi des médicaments et demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits génériques. Comme perspectives d'avenir, il souhaite avoir une grande locale et assurer l'avenir des enfants(Père de 02 enfants).
texts.en: Koffi is 34 years old and a nurse. He resells medications and is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy generic medicines. In the future, he would like to have a large locale and to ensure that his two children have a good future.

loans.use: to buy medications.

loans.name: Miagoubé

texts.fr: Pour acheter des pièces pour voitures, mr Miagoubé âgé de 29ans fait son quatrième prêt à WAGES. Il souhaite avec le profit réalisé agrandir son activité et mieux se prendre en charge. Ce dernier a démarré en 2004.
texts.en: In order to be able to buy spare parts for cars, Miagoubé, who is 29 years old, is requesting his fourth loan from WAGES. He would like to use his profits to expand his business and to become more self-sufficient. He started his business in 2004.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Simonette Claudine

texts.fr:
Simonette, une femme dynamique et travailleuse, a 37 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est plombier salarié. Elle a cinq enfants de 17, 13, 10, 6 et 4 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés.C'était une femme paysanne qui vivait à la campagne avant son mariage. 
Mais pour aider son mari à soutenir sa famille, elle a dû se lancer dans une activité de vente de friperie il y a déjà 12 ans, après la naissance de son deuxième enfant. Actuellement, elle en ajoute d'autres articles pour diversifier les marchandises , des peluches et sacs dames à l'occasion. et à part ça, elle fait d'autres petits boulots dès qu'elle en a l'occasion: c'est une femme débrouillarde.
Son désire est d'aller le plus loin possible, d'avancer afin de pouvoir améliorer davantage le niveau de vie de la famille et d'offrir à ses enfants une meilleur scolarisation. Elle voudrait qu'ils réussissent dans leurs études et feront carrières dans quelques choses de solides. Les deux époux se débrouillent très bien  mutuellement pour élever leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Simonette, a dynamic and hardworking woman, is 37 years old. She is married and her husband works for a plumbing company. She has five children aged 17, 13, 10, 6 and 4 years old - all of them attend school. Before her marriage, she was a rural woman living in the countryside. However, to help her husband to support the family, she had to start a secondhand clothing business 12 years ago, following the birth of her second child.
Lately, she has added further items to diversify her merchandise - cuddly toys and secondhand ladies bags. In addition, she has other casual jobs that she does when she has the chance - she is a woman who gets things done. 
Her desire is to get as far as possible, to succeed in order to be able to further improve the family's quality of life, and to give her children better schooling. She wants them to succeed in their studies and to make solid careers. The couple work very well together in raising their children.

loans.use: to buy secondhand jumpers and trousers, as well as cuddly toys and secondhand ladies handbags.

loans.name: Issa's Group

texts.fr: Issa qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, portant les lunettes de soleil est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Massakoni au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Issa, âgé de 44 ans, est le père de 6 enfants âgés de 8 à 15 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’amour de l’agricluture qu’il paratique en complément de son activité commerciale l’ont poussé à pratiquer une activité agricole depuis 35 ans. Issa cultive le maïs, le sorgho, le riz sur et pratique le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluies. Issa entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et de la perspective de pouvoir obtenir de meilleurs rendements. Cette année Issa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 35 ans qu’Issa cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Issa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  faire de l’élevage en achetant des moutons et des boeufs. Enfin Issa espère surtout pouvoir « nourrir sa famille » en assurant la sécurité alimentaire.
texts.en:
Issa is sitting on the far right in the photo, wearing sunglasses.  He is a member of a group of eleven farmers who all work with the field partner myAgro.  The farmers all live and work in the village of Massakoni, south-east of Bamako, in Mali. 

Issa is 44 years old and has six children between the ages of eight and fifteen years old.  Three of his children currently attend school.  Issa has been working in agriculture for thirty-five years, alongside his commercial business.  He grows maize, sorghum, rice and vegetables on his land and has to cope with a lack of rain.

This will be Issa's first year working with myAgro.  He plans to buy seed and fertilizer to increase the crop of maize on his 0.125 hectares of land.  He has been growing maize for thirty-five years because it is a valuable food source and also for its market value.  Issa will use his earnings to buy sheep and cattle for fattening up and resale.  He especially wants to be able to feed his family well.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow maize.

loans.name: Florima Group

texts.fr:
Mme  RIHANATA est responsable du groupe FLORIMA. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son quartier.
 Elle veut s’acheter  10pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne  s'acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Rihanata is the leader of the Florima group. She is married and the mother of 3 children. The eldest is 12 years old and the youngest, 9 months. Two of the children attend school and Rihanata is responsible for 6 people.

She has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) for a year. She gets her supplies at the markets in her district. She would like to buy 10 pagnes. She wants to use her profits to strengthen her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes.

loans.name: Kouboalem Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADISSA est la responsable du groupe KOUBOALEM. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme fait la coiffure et vend des gâteaux  depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques de son quartier. 
Mme veut s’acheter 02sacs de farine de blé et 02bidon d’huile de 20l pour faire ses gâteaux.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Adissa is the leader of the Kouboalem group. She is married and the mother of 3 children. The eldest is 13 years old and the youngest, 5. She is responsible for 5 people.

Adissa has been doing people's hair and selling cakes for 13 years. She gets her supplies in the shops in her district. She would like to buy 2 bags of wheat flour and 2 20-litre cans of oil with which to make her cakes. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She aims to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of wheat flour and 2 20-litre cans of oil with which to make cakes.

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve sur la photo assise sur la chaise devant tenant la pochette avec un foulard blanc, portant des habits de couleurs noir bleu, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bassian au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé.  L'agriculture qui lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance alimentaire  pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Minata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Minata cultive le mais, le mil, le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et d'herbicides. Minata entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison des formations et techniques agricoles et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Minata cultive l’arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Minata is sitting at the front in the photo, holding her myAgro bag.  She is wearing a white scarf and black and blue clothing.  She is a member of a group of eight farmers who all work with the field partner myAgro.  The women all live and work in the village of Bassian, south-east of Bamako, in Mali. 

Minata is 45 years old and has four children, of whom one currently attends school.  Minata has been working in agriculture for thirty years and it is the main source of food for her family.  She grows maize, millet and cotton on her land and has to cope with a lack of agricultural supplies, good quality fertilizer and herbicides.

This will be Minata's second year working with myAgro.  She works with them for their training and good agricultural techniques, and in order to improve her harvests.  This year, Minata plans to buy fertilizer to increase the crop of peanuts on her 0.125 hectares of land.  She has been growing peanuts for thirty years because of their good market value.  Minata will use her earnings to buy livestock to raise.  She hopes to be able to build a house for her family and pay for marriages for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos y su cónyuge en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe. región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 15 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias de el. El préstamo lo va a utilizar para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his five children and partner in the district of Cañaris, a community dedicated to agriculture and livestock which is located in the province of Ferreñafe, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He cultivates coffee, and has been involved in this activity for over 15 years so he has experience in the field and regular customers who speak well of him. The loan will be used for the purchase of compost and fertilizer to maintain his coffee crops. With it he hopes to offer better quality coffee to his customers which will allow him to improve his sales and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Nahourtenga Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAIDOU est responsable du groupe NONGTAABA DE NAHOURTENGA. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 04 vont à l’école et il a 10 personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage  depuis 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne au barrage de son quartier. 
 Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 08 sacs d'engrais.
 Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour  réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Saidou is the leader of the Nongtaaba de Nahourtenga group. He is married and the father of 7 children. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest, 3. Four of the children go to school and Saidou is responsible for 10 people.

Saidou has been a market gardener for 20 years. He gets his supplies near the barrage in his district. He plans to use the money he is provided with to buy 8 bags of fertiliser. He wants to reinvest the profits he makes thanks to this loan back into his business. He aims to ensure that his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy 8 bags of fertiliser.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Boye est l’homme au milieu tenant dans la main  la corde attaché au mouton. 
Boye est un éleveur de mouton résidant au Mali, marié, père de 05 enfants dont 01 scolarisé et 04 non scolarisés. ils sont âgée de 10 à 01 ans et sa conjointe fait le ménage à la maison, il fait l’élevage de moutons il y-a de cela 04 ans.
Pour  quelques soucis financiers dans l’exercice de son  élevage  de moutons il a jugé nécessaire de prendre l’argent  de l’IMF pour acheter  des moutons. Il achète les moutons dans une foire de la localité et après avoir les élevés il les revend. Il maitrise son élevage de moutons et  il tire  des profits à la vente de ses moutons en moyenne  150000f par cycle de prêts. Le profit sert  à l’amélioration des conditions de vie  de sa famille, telque la santé, l’éducation. son rêve est  la construction de sa maison en semi dure. Il a des inquiétudes majeurs sur le marché tel que la baisse des prix ,et les maladies des moutons.
texts.en:
Boye is the man in the centre of the photo, holding the sheep on a rope.  He lives in Mali and has been raising sheep for four years.  Boye is married and has five children aged between one and ten years old.  One of his children attends school and his wife looks after their home.

Because he has a few financial problems with his business, Boye has decided to take a loan from the field partner, RMCR to buy more sheep.  He buys them from a local fair, raises them and then sells them on.  He manages to earn an average of 150,000 francs CFA over a loan cycle.

Boye's profits will improve the living standards of his family by providing healthcare and education.  His dream is to be able to construct a house.  He has several concerns about the livestock market, such as low prices and disease within his flock of sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic groceries, sweets and biscuits, butter, diapers, etc....

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y comidas que prepara ella misma y los ofrece en su domicilio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de golosinas y de esta manera abastecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 58 years old and lives in the district of Oyotún. Its locals make a living from agriculture, trade and livestock, and it is located in the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling sweets and foods that she prepares herself and works from her home. She has experience in this business and her neighbours speak well of her. She has requested a loan to purchase wholesale sweets to stock her business, thereby generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sweets wholesale to stock her business

loans.name: Bas Nere De Yaoghin Group

texts.fr:
Mr OUSMANE représente le groupe  BAS NERE DE YAOGHIN. Marié, il est père de 01enfant. Il est âgé de 18mois.
Mr collecte et vend les objets recyclable depuis 09ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son secteur. 
Mr veut s’acheter 20batteries usés, 60chaises usés, du fer etc.
Avec  ses bénéfices, il veut renforcer son activité et créer si possible d'autres activité. Mr ambitionne toujours ouvrir un grand magasin d’objets usés.
texts.en: Ousmane represents the Bas Nere De Yaoghin group. He is married with one child aged 18 months. He has been collecting and selling recyclable goods for nine years. He gets his stock in his neighbourhood. He wants to buy 20 used batteries, 60 used chairs, some iron etc. With the profits he wants to expand his business, and to create new businesses if possible. Ousmane's ambition is still to open a big shop selling used objects.

loans.use: to buy 20 used batteries, 60 old chairs, iron etc.

loans.name: Palestina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALESTINA” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artículos para el hogar, venta de ropa, venta de floreros, venta de maíz, venta de fideo, venta de edredones y venta de CD’s.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra cortinas y manteles por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Palestine" Communal Bank will start its tenth cycle at Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II Focal Point. The group consists of eight members and is headed by a board of which Sandra is President. The group members' businesses are varied, and include the sale of household items, clothes, vases, corn, noodles, quilts and CDs.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microentrepreneurs, of which Sandra is one. She notes that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, having been invited by a friend who was a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling household items. She states that she learned this business several years ago from her parents.
 
The loan that she is requesting is to increase her capital. She will buy curtains and tablecloths wholesale from wholesalers in the city of La Paz and will sell them in her retail store. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase curtains and tablecloths wholesale.

loans.name: Dieu Est La Group

texts.fr:
Mme  ODILE est responsable du groupe DIEU EST LA. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 05 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 01 enfant va à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son quartier.
 Elle veut s’acheter  05pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et épargner. Elle ambitionne pouvoir voyager dans des payer exterieur.
texts.en:
Odile is the supervisor of the Dieu est Là group. She is married and the mother of two children. The elder is five and the younger three years old. One of them attends school, and in total four people are dependent on her. She has sold 'pagnes' (traditional printed fabrics) for two years. She buys them in her local markets.
She wants to buy five pagnes, and to use the profits to both grow her business and to save. Her ambition is to be able to travel internationally.

loans.use: to buy five traditional fabric 'pagnes'.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es soltera, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, entre otros, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años y cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría. Con esto Teresa espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is single and lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, a rural area located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on Peru's north coast. Life in her town is quiet, and the people earn a living from agriculture, raising livestock, and trade.

Teresa earns a living by raising and selling animals, such as pigs, chickens, ducks, and others. She has been doing this for more than three years and has a good reputation among her neighbors.

The loan will be used to buy more animals and to carry out repairs and maintenance where she grows them. This way, Teresa hopes to be able to offer a greater variety of animals to her customers, generate more income, and thus improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to carry out repairs and maintenance where she grows them.

loans.name: Nayinere Group

texts.fr:
Mme RACHELLE représente le groupe NAYINERE. Elle se porte. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école et elle à 09 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend de la farine maïs et divers condiments (légumes) depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés environnants. 
Mme veut s’acheter 09sacs de 100kg de maïs et 01sac de sel iode.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  renforcer son fonds de commerce. Mme ambitionne s'acheter une parcelle afin de faire l'élevage.
texts.en:
Rachelle represents the Nayinere group. She manages OK. Married, she is the mother of four children. The oldest is 30 and the youngest 18 years old. One of them attends school, and she has nine people dependent on her. She has sold cornflour and various condiments (vegetables) for the last five years. She buys her supplies in the neighbouring markets. She wants to buy nine 100kg sacks of corn and one sack of iodised salt.
With her profit, she wants to increase her capital. Her ambition is to buy a plot of land in order to rear livestock.

loans.use: to buy nine 100kg sacks of corn and one sack of iodised salt.

loans.name: Benkadi Dounguel Group

texts.fr:
Mamadou est le monsieur au milieu qui tient le mouton.

Mamadou est le trésorier de son groupe. Jovial et accueillant, Mamadou est âgé de 52ans, marié, il est père de 4 enfants. Ses enfants sont âgés de 4 à 18 ans donc 2 vont à l’école. Il utilise le prêt pour faire le commerce de montons, il s’approvisionne sur le marché de local et les revend à BAMAKO. Analphabète, Mamadou exerce le commerce de moutons depuis  plus 10 ans. Son rêve de devenir emboucheur de grand bétail. Il a bénéfice prévisionnelle de 10 000 à 20 000FCFA.
Mamadou a fait recourt au RMCR pour avoir de prêts afin de pouvoir acheter beaucoup de moutons.
Mamadou veut avoir un prêt plus conséquent qui lui aidera à acheter trois moutons et deux bœufs. Il est content de mener cette activité parce qu’avec les bénéfices il arrive à faire face aux besoins de sa famille et aussi à assurer la scolarité de ses deux enfants.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a man in the middle of the photo holding the sheep.

Mamadou is the treasurer of his group. Jovial and warm-hearted, Mamadou is a 52-year-old married father to four children. His children are aged between four and 18 years old, two of whom are currently receiving an education. He is putting this loan towards his sheep business. He purchases his livestock from the local market and resells them in Bamako. Illiterate, Mamadou has been running this sheep business for over 10 years. It is his dream to rear larger livestock. He has been granted a provisional benefit of 10,000 to 20,000 FCFA.

Mamadou turned to RMCR for a loan so he could purchase many sheep. He wants to take out a more substantial loan which will help him purchase three sheep and two cows. He is happy with his work because the profits allow him to meet his family's needs and also pay two of his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for resale

loans.name: Yta Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos, uno aun depende de ellos. Trinidad terminó la primaria y no pudo seguir estudiando porque sus padres no contaban con recursos económicos, por ello ella ha trabajado mucho por darles la educación a sus hijos.
Actualmente vende asados en una vía muy importante de la ciudad, atiende todas las tardes sin falta ya que es la forma de poder generar ingresos a su hogar; su esposo es albañil y lleva muchos años dedicándose a este trabajo. Trinidad además de la venta de asados se dedica a criar chanchos y pollos, trabaja muy duro por sus hijos. Tanto ella como su esposo han podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles todos los estudios.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de carne para sus asados y además quiere incrementar sus chanchitos. Trinidad agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad para progresar y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 43 and lives in the city of Santo Domingo with her husband and two children, one of whom still depends on them. Trinidad finished primary school and could not continue studying because her parents lacked the economic resources. For that reason, she has worked hard to give her children an education. 

She currently sells barbecued items in a major street in the city. She works every afternoon without fail because it is her way of generating income for her household. Her husband is a bricklayer and has been doing that job for many years. Aside from selling barbecued meat, Trinidad also earns a living raising pigs and chickens. She works very hard for her children. Both her and her husband have managed to get ahead and give their children a full education. 

She will use the loan to purchase meat for her barbecue stall and she would also like to purchase more piglets. Trinidad is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity to progress and give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase meat and to purchase more piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit, local soap and fuel.

loans.name: Kelenya Group

texts.fr:
Le monsieur debout au milieu se nomme Adama, il est client du RMCR et membre du groupe kelenya.
Age de 37 ans Adama est marié et est père de 12 enfants, âgés de 2 à 17 ans dont 9 vont à l’école. Adama est soudeur et fait la fabrication de machine à moudre et de charrette.
Adama mène cette activité depuis 10 ans. Il s’est orienté vers le RMCR pour avoir un prêt pour fabriquer des charrettes. Aujourd’hui Avec un prêt acquis il arrive à fabriquer plus de charrettes. Adama est fier de mener cette activité puis qu’il peut avoir 50 000F cfa comme bénéfice par charrette et cela lui permet de faire face aux différents besoins de sa famille et aussi à prendre en charge les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Adama n’a pas de problème dans son travail, son ambition est de pouvoir fabriquer beaucoup de charrettes  s’il parvenait à avoir un prêt plus élevé.
texts.en:
The man standing in the middle of the photo is called Adama. He is a client of RMCR and a member of the Kelenya Group.

37-year-old Adama is a married father to 12 children between the ages of two and 17 years old. Nine of them are currently receiving an education. Adama earns a living as a welder and builds grinders and carts.

Adama has been carrying out this work for the past 10 years. He turned towards RMCR for a loan so he could build carts. With this loan, he is now able to build even more carts. Adama is proud of his work as it allows him to earn a 50,000 FCFA profit per cart which allows him to meet his family's many needs and also pay for his children's school fees. Adama encounters no difficulties in his work. His goal is to take out an even larger loan so he can build even more carts.

loans.use: to build carts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Gouanssira est celle qui a levé la main
Gouanssira est une Malienne agricultrice âgée de 45 ans marie, mère de 5 enfants dont 2 vont à l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur pendant hivernage et exerce aussi le commerce de céréale après hivernage ils sont tous analphabètes. Gouanssira à commencer l’agriculture depuis 20 ans, elle n’a pas été satisfaite de ses champs d’arachide, car chaque année elle fait 1 hectare. Elle a beaucoup pensé  à l’avenir de ses enfants, elle fait recourt au RMCR pour demander un fond pour ses champs d’arachide. Après la récolte, le profil tiré dans le champ d’arachide lui permet de bien habiller les enfants et de bien s’occuper les élèves. Elle achète les semences d’arachides dans le marché de la zone. 	La vente des arachides se passe au village où au marché.
texts.en:
Gouanssira is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. 

Gouanssira is a 45-year-old farmer from Mali. She is a married mother to five children, two of whom are currently receiving an education. Her husband earns a living as a farmer during the winter season and also sells cereals after this period. They are both illiterate. Gouanssira has been farming for 20 years. She has been dissatisfied with her peanut field as each year she only has one hectare to work with. After thinking long and hard about her children's future, she turned to RMCR in order to take out a loan for her peanut field. Following the harvest, the profits from her peanut field will allow her to clothe her children and pay for their school fees. She purchases peanut seeds from her local market and sells her produce in the village or at market.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seeds for their fields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of mayonnaise, 15 litres of oil, 2 packages of school books, 2 boxes of Bic pens, 5 kilos of powdered milk, one box of soap, a half-box of bleach, 1 box of tea and 50 kilos of sugar.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
María es una señora de 45 años, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos, habitan en la ciudad de Santo Domingo  ya varios años, cuentan con una humilde casa que la han podido obtener gracias al esfuerzo diario de su trabajo
María hace años atrás trabajaba para una señora vendiendo ropa y edredones, al ver que le iba tan bien ella dedicó emprender en la misma actividad. Ya lleva varios años trabajando, ella recorre con una maleta y su cuaderno de apuntes, visita a sus clientes fieles y a los recomendados; en compañía de María va una hija quien le ayuda haciendo las cuentas ya que ella es una persona analfabeta que apenas sabe escribir su nombre. María no estudió ya que sus padres no contaban con recursos, pero aun así es feliz porque le ayuda mucho su hija a quien si le dio los estudios, tiene todo el apoyo de su familia y son ellos que le han ayudado a que comience a escribir.
La familia de María es humilde pero muy unida, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, ambos se ayudan y salen adelante.
Con el crédito que recibió podrá incrementar de a poco su negocio, comprará más ropa, calzado, medias y sábanas;  ya en un futuro tiene planificado contar con un local estable. Desea que sus ventas incrementen para cumplir su sueño. Agradece a la institución y a kiva por apoyar a los pequeños microempresarios.
texts.en:
Maria is a 45-year-old woman. She lives together with her husband and two children in the city of Santo Domingo. For a couple of years now they have a humble house, which they have been able to buy because of the daily effort she puts into her work.

Maria used to work as a saleswoman selling clothes and duvets. Although she was doing well, she decided to start her own business in the same field. She is already doing this for a couple of years. She goes around with a suitcase and a notebook, visiting loyal and recommended customers. Maria is accompanied by one of her daughters, who helps her writing bills, because Maria is illiterate and can barely write her own name.

Maria did not go to school because her parents did not have the means. But she is still happy because her daughter, whom she did sent to school, is helping her a lot. She has all the support of her family and because of their help she started to learn how to write.

Maria's family is humble but very close. Her husband works as a journalist. They support each other and get ahead.

With the loan she received, she can slowly grow her business, buy more clothes, footwear, socks and sheets. She is planning to have her own fixed store in the future. She hopes that her sales will increase to be able to fulfill her dream. She thanks the credit bank and Kiva for supporting small micro-entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and slowly grow her business because she plans to own a fixed store in the future.

loans.name: Ivan Enrique

texts.es:
Ivan, de 37 años, inicio con un negocio de reparación de electrodomésticos  hace aproximadamente 7 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en su esposa y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para electrodomésticos que le hacen falta para continuar con su servicio.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener su negocio y a su familia brindándole una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Ivan para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Ivan is 37 years old. About seven years ago, he started a business of repairing electrical household appliances with the urge to find work, which generates an income to be able to survive.

At the moment, he finds his motivation to work tirelessly in his wife because he wants to offer her the best life and development.

He is requesting a loan to buy the spare parts he needs to continue his service of electrical household appliances. With this loan he will be able to continue his business and offer his family a better quality of life.

Support Ivan so he can continue his work!

loans.use: to buy the spare parts he needs to continue his service of electrical household appliances.

loans.name: Cristobal Segundo

texts.es:
El señor Cristobal es un hombre emprendedor y aplicado, desde hace 10 años comenzó con una legumbreria que hasta ahora le ha dado muy buenos resultados. 

El vive en el municipio de Sincelejo con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El trabaja de lunes a sábado durante 12 horas atendiendo un número de clientes bajo.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar productos a granel como mango, mandarina, banano, entre otras frutas y de éste modo satisfacer los deseos de los clientes que le piden estos productos.

Esta ayuda le permitirá inyectar variedad a su negocio y le brindara la jugosa oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Cristobal is a enterprising and diligent man who started selling fruit ten years ago and so far it has given him a good income. He lives in the town of Sincelejo with his wife and his three children.

He works from Monday to Saturday, 12 hours a day, attending a small number of customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy fruit in bulk, such as mangos, tangerines, bananas, and thus satisfy his customer's wishes, who ask for these products.

This help allows him to introduce variety into his business and gives him the great opportunity of increasing his sales and his family's income.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk, such as mangos, tangerines, bananas, and thus satisfy the customer's wishes.

loans.name: Yohan Alberto

texts.es:
Yohan, un hombre de 25 años de edad intenta salir adelante y pagar sus estudios gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el apoyo económico de su familia. 

Trabaja solo todos los días durante 8 horas.
Buscando tener la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.
De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Apoya a Yohan con su negocio!
texts.en:
Yohan, 25, is trying to get ahead and pay for his education thanks to the store he was able to open through much effort, patience and sacrifice.  He has been able to earn an income to support his family economically.

He works alone 8 hours a day and is trying to run the best family business in the sector.  The loan he is requesting is to buy more variety and increase his stock of grains and groceries.  This will allow him to overcome difficulties such as lower sales and competition.

This loan will give him a great opportunity to consolidate his store as the most productive one in the neighborhood.  It will also allow him to meet his ongiong goal of wanting to improve the living conditions of his house.

Please support Yohan and his business!

loans.use: To buy more variety and increase his stock of grains and groceries.

loans.name: Maria Elcy

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 26 años de edad fuerte, trabajadora, humilde y servicial lleva trabajando en su finca gran parte de su vida y todos sus conocimientos los aprendió gracias a su familia que realizan actividades similares. 

Madre de un hijo menor de edad el cual quiere educar con las buenas costumbres del campo pero tratando de que pueda acceder a una buena educación y no le toque un trabajo tan pesado para sobrevivir pues no cualquier persona ejerce esta profesión. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de un terreno para iniciar con una siembra de alimentos buscando mejorar y aumentar su producción pues es soñadora y piensa es darles a sus hijos todas las herramientas para forjar un excelente futuro
texts.en:
Maria, 28, is strong, hard-working, humble and service oriented.  She has worked on a farm most of her life and learned everything she knows from her family who were involved in similar activities.

She has a young son and wants him to learn about farming's good values, but she also wants him to receive a good education and not have to go into a line of work that is so hard, as not just anyone can work in farming.

She is requesting a loan to buy land to start planting crops in an effort to improve and increase production.  She is a dreamer and wants to give her son all the tools he needs to carve out an excellent future.

loans.use: To buy land and start planting crops to increase and improve production.

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Maria, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Cocorna.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.
Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra cerdosa pequeños para la cria.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Hardworking and a dreamer are two words used to describe Maria perfectly. She is a hardworking, family woman who does whatever is within her reach to offer a better quality of life to her children. 

She raises and sells pigs in the town of Cocorna. This is a very common activity in the region and many of its residents do it. She has a lot of knowledge about this subject and thinks that she needs a small boost to increase her sales and expand her business. That is why she is asking for financial help to invest in buying piglets to raise.

With this loan, she will be able to continue with her activity, which is the only source of income for her family. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders and to Corporación Interactuar, who have made it possible for her business to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices for resale.

loans.name: Yudis Judith

texts.es:
La señora Yudis es una mujer muy emprendedora y creativa, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de transporte de mercancía y mensajería.

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que ella salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposo y sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un vehículo el cual le permitirá iniciar con este negocio soñado.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a una mujer llena de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Yudis is a very enterprising, creative woman who has wanted to be independent for a long time, running her own merchandise transport and messenger business.

Now she can actually realize her dream thanks to her significant work capacity and the support she is receiving from Corporacion Interactuar, and those people who wish for her to prosper in her business.

Her husband and children depend on the income from the business, and she wants her children to learn about it for their future.

She is requesting a loan to buy a vehicle to start the business.

Your loan will help this woman who is full of life and drive for her family!

loans.use: To buy a vehicle and start a business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Ivan Camilo

texts.es:
Ivan es un humilde habitante del municipio de Puerto Salgar, trabajador, dedicado y muy juicioso.

Es soltero y día a día intensa salir adelante y apoyar la economía de su hogar con la venta de minutos a celular y golosinas.

Actividad que realiza en una pequeña mesa que ubica en una acera cerca a su casa y en esta exhibe sus productos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de golosinas y comestibles, además de renovar los celulares desde donde ofrece el servicio de telefonía.

Apoya  a un joven con grandes ganas de salir adelante y superarse.
texts.en:
Ivan is a humble, hard-working, dedicated, sensible person who lives in Puerto Salgar.  He is single and works day after day to support the economy of his household through his cell phone service and sweets sales.

He works from a small table on the sidewalk near his house, where he displays his products.

He is requesting a loan to buy a variety of sweets and snack foods, as well as renew the cell phones he uses to provide service.

Please support this young man who is very determined to get ahead and improve his situation.

loans.use: To buy a variety of sweets and snack foods, and renew his cell phones.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
Maria ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes negocios en el municipio de Cocorna a lo largo de su vida y en el campo.
Es una madre amorosa y responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia en su proceso productivo.

Ella siempre fue muy inquieta y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que la motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes y hacerla muy reconocida en el sector.

Hoy en día es una mujer amable y muy emprendedora, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.

Ella solicita apoyo económico para obtener un préstamo y realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran distribuidora de víveres, considera que poco a poco y con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.
texts.en:
Maria has been able to accumulate a lot of pleasant experiences in her life. One of them is having been able to work in different businesses in the town of Cocorna during her life, as well as in the countryside. She is a loving and responsible mother and she is very aware of the meaning of family in her productive process. 

She was always very restless with a great vocation for service. These qualities motivated her to start her own general store and make it become well known in the area.

To day she is a kind and very enterprising woman. She is always seeking alternatives so her customers will feel well served and be buying quality products. She is asking for financial support to obtain a loan and buy a variety of staple products. She is planning on increasing what she has to sell and she wants to have a much bigger inventory. This way, she can have products available to her customers.  

Her biggest dream is to have a big grocery distribution center. She thinks that little by little and with the help of Corporación Interactuar, she can achieve it.

loans.use: to buy a variety of staple products.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karina es madre soltera, tiene 26 años y vive junto a su pequeño hijo de tres meses en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad caracterizada por el comercio y la producción.
Karina actualmente tiene un salón de belleza, adquirió experiencia gracias a su madre que le enseñó todo del arte ya que ella también contaba con uno, luego de ello Karina se especializó en belleza en institutos de la ciudad. Con su trabajo constante ella pudo ponerse su propio salón el mismo que lleva funcionando varios años en un sector muy comercial de la ciudad, le va muy bien que incluso por la afluencia de personas ella tuvo que contratar a cuatro chicas para que le ayuden en el trabajo diario. 
Su gabinete es de dos plantas, realiza cortes de cabello, manicura, tintes, masajes entre otros, se siente feliz de poder dar empleo a chicas que desean superarse como ella lo hizo hace años atrás, su sueño es que ellas adquieran experiencia y en un futuro puedan abrir sus propios negocios.
Karina con el crédito de Fundación Alternativa y del proyecto kiva podrá ampliar su negocio ya que de oportunidad le están arrendando un local adjunto al suyo y desea crecer más ya que el espacio es más amplio. Agradece a las instituciones que ayudan a los microempresarios a superarse y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Karina, 26, is single and has a three-month-old son.  They live in the city of Santo Domingo which is known for its commerce and production.

Karina currently runs a beauty salon.  She acquired her experience thanks to her mother who had her own salon.  Afterwards, Karina received specialized training in institutes in the city.  Through her consistent work she was able to establish her own salon which has been in business for several years in a very commercial area of the city.  It is going very well for her, so much so that she had to hire four assistants to help with the growing amount of customers.

Her salon is in a two-storey building.  She does hair cuts, manicures, color, massage, etc.  She is happy to be able to provide employment to young women who want to improve their situation as she did years ago.  Her dream is for them to acquire expderience and open their own salons in the future.

With the loan from Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva, Karina can expand her business by renting a space next to hers.  She is grateful to the institutions who help small business owners improve their situation and meet their goals.

loans.use: To expand her business and serve as an example to her assistants.

loans.name: Juan Isaac

texts.es:
Las vacas adornan la finca de Juan, un agricultor y ganadero de 35 años de edad que con mucho esfuerzo ha llevado adelante a su familia, gracias a las inversiones que ha hecho este trabajador en su negocio. Anteriormente Juan había solicitado un crédito, con el cual compró semillas de frijoles, abono y todos los materiales para la siembra de esa temporada con la de maíz, dicha cosecha trajo consigo grandes ingresos a su hogar. Razón por la que desea agradecer a todas las personas que le ayudaron con este préstamo. 
Por el momento, las vacas son el centro de atención en la finca, sin embargo pronto una nueva cosecha será parte del arte de este cambo, por lo que Juan solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar semillas de frijoles, fertilizantes y para pagar a los trabajadores que serán parte de este gran trabajo. Con esta inversión podrá aprovechar la temporada de invierno que pronto se aproxima y que le ayudará también a producir una siembra de calidad. Al cancelar considera seguir trabajando fuerte para seguir creciendo junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Cows decorate Juan's far,. He is a 35 year old farmer and rancher who with much hard work has brought his family forward, thanks to the investments this  hard worker has made in his business. Previously, Juan asked for a loan. With it, he bought bean seeds, fertilizer and all the planting materials for the that and the corn season. That harvest brought with it good income to his home. That is why he wants to thank all the people who helped with the loan. 

Right now, the cows are the center of attention at the farm. Nonetheless, soon a new harvest will be a part of the the art of the change. That is why Juan is asking for a new loan to buy bean seeds and fertilizer, as well as to pay the workers who will be a part of this great work. With this investment, he will be able to take advantage of the winter season which is drawing near, and this will also help him to produce a quality crop. When he pays it off, he plans on working hard to continue growing with his family.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fertilizer,as well as to pay the workers.

loans.name: Sairagul

texts.ru: Сайрагул, 48 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. Сайрагул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Сайрагул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 6 коров и 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайрагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Сайрагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Sairagul is 48 years old, married, and has two sons. Sairagul rears animals as the main source of income for her family, having started 25 years ago. Thanks to her hard work, today Sairagul has six cows and 40 sheep. Her monthly income is up to 17,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Sairagul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy three cows. Sairagul plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business and building a house.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos vende frutas en una pequeña mesa ubicada en la calle en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá. Allí trabaja y atiende varios clientes en el día.

El quiere diversificar sus ingresos y tener una oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas, es por esto que desea tener un negocio de venta de empanadas.

Para esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara un carro de comidas e insumos como carne, pollo, maíz, entre otros, para la realización de estos alimentos.

De este negocio depende su esposa y su sostenimiento.
texts.en:
Carlos sells fruit at a small street stall located in the town of Puerto Boyacá. He works there and serves customers during the day. 

He wants to broaden his income and have the chance to improve sales, which is why he wants to have an empanada stand.

He is asking for a loan which he will use to buy a food van and supplies such as beef, chicken and corn among other things, to prepare these dishes.

His wife and upkeep depend on his business.

loans.use: to buy a van to sell meals and supplies such as beef, chicken, and corn among other things, in order to prepare these dishes.

loans.name: Remi Venance

texts.fr:
Rémi Venance est un père de famille diligent et déterminé lorsqu'il s'agit du bien-être de sa famille.Il est toujours prêt à donner le meilleur de lui-même pour sa femme et ses enfants.
Rémi Venance gagne sa vie en vendant différentes sortes d'articles. Il a débuté en 1995 et il bénéficiait depuis l'appui de sa femme dans l'exercice de son commerce.Les marchandises changent suivant la saison et les circonstances. Actuellement, il vend des jouets car c'est la période de la circoncision des petits garçons.
La famille effectue aussi de l'élevage porcin.
Remi Venance a 45 ans et il a cinq enfants de 19,16,14,11, et 5 ans dont les trois derniers vont actuellement à l'école. 
La famille a déjà acquis un terrain, et l'objectif est d'y construire une maison.
texts.en:
Rémi Venance is a father who is diligent and determined when it comes to his family's well-being. He is always ready to give the best of himself for his wife and his children. Rémi Venance earns a living by selling various things. He started his business in 1995 and has since benefited from his wife's support. The merchandise they sell changes depending on the seasons and circumstances. He is currently selling toys as this is the traditional period in which young boys are circumcised. The family also raises pigs.

Rémi Venance is 45 years old and has 5 children aged 19,16,14,11, and 5, the latter three of whom attend school. The family has already bought some land and plans to build a house on it.

loans.use: to buy various toys.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
El olor que proviene de la casa de Irene, te hace llegar en un segundo a su comedor, tal como si te hipnotizara. Con más de dos años de experiencia vendiendo comida, esta emprendedora siente que su negocio va mejorando cada día y más cuando invierte en él, comenta. Anteriormente ella tuvo un préstamo, por el cual agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron, puesto que pudo comprar res, carne de pollo, frutas y granos básicos para abastecer su negocio.  
Irene al ver los resultados positivos de esa última inversión, desea volver hacerlo. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, carne de pollo, res, azúcar y frutas para preparar la mejor comida y los mejores frescos. Con esto su clientela se aumentará y podrá tener mayores ganancias. En un futuro le gustaría solicitar un préstamo de vivienda, con el cual pueda mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
